Cristina, 55, is married to César and they have six children.  She and her husband live together in their own house with a granddaughter.  Cristina is a responsible woman.  She tends to customers in her soda fountain where she sells soft-drinks, ice-cream, sandwiches, cakes, etc.  She’s been in this business about 15 years and mentions that she does very well because she chats with her customers who are neighbors and friends and she feels good.  Four months ago she bought computers and opened another business: Internet access booths.  She and her husband manage both businesses.  She says that she’s very happy because at her age she still works and earns what’s necessary to live decently.  Cristina used to work in agriculture and thanks to her efforts was able to save and invest in these businesses.

Her greatest urgency is to buy more soft-drinks and ice-cream that are in high demand because of the hot weather for her soda fountain.  She also needs to service the computers.

This is her 13th MFP loan and she’s very enthusiastic about her team’s work because she’s its punctual treasurer.  Her “Los Pioneros de Capelo” communal bank is one of the oldest in the zone; she’s aware of that and feels proud.  She will use the money to buy ice-cream and soft-drinks for her soda fountain and also to service her machines.

loans.use: to service computers and also to buy ice-cream and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Bazardari

texts.en: Bazardari is 24 years old and lives with his wife and son in a yurt (ger) in Uvs province. They are a young couple. He has lately started a woodwork industry (making up the roof, the opening and frame on top of a ger and door). He is planning to do this business constantly in the future. He is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy raw materials for woodwork industry. He said "I had already gotten order for my new business from clients in this month." He is a hardworking person.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for woodwork industry

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 34 years old and married with four children.

Mary Ann works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Mary Ann has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Mary Ann aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Micelda

texts.en:
Micelda is 33 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Micelda has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from raising pigs and selling charcoal.

Micelda aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Doña Guillermina de 39 años de edad, labora como sastra desde hace 8 años, en su casa de habitaciòn en el Barrio Linda Vista de Nueva Guinea, su esposo es maestro de Obra el cual la ayuda con sus gastos personales y con los compromisos adquiridos, esta familia es responsable y muy trabajadora, es reconocida en su barrio, tiene 2 hijas de los cuales se siente orgullosos.                                

Este crèdito lo requiere para mejorar su casa acondicionando su taller de costura y asi poderle ofrecer mejores condiciones a sus clientes.  Su sueño es mejorar sus condiciones de vidad, que sus hijas sean personas de bien y que no les falte lo basico en el hogar.
texts.en:
Guillermina is 39 years old. She has been working as a seamstress for 8 years in her house located in Linda Vista, a neighborhood of the town of Nueva Guinea. Her husband is a master builder and he helps her paying for their personal expenses as well as for the engagements they have undertaken. This is a responsible and very hardworking family: they are well-known in their neighborhood and they have 2 daughters they are very proud of.

The loan she is requesting will be used to make improvements to her house by equipping her sewing workshop in order to offer better serving conditions to her customers. She dreams of improving her standard of living, that her daughters become respectable people and that her household never lacks of basic commodities.

loans.use: To make improvements to her house.

loans.name: Jose Albeiro

texts.es:
Jose inició el negocio de la tienda general desde hace unos 2 años buscando mejorar la situación económica del hogar y ofrecer una mayor estabilidad para su familia. Pese a no contar con mucho capital, su esfuerzo le ha permitido ir superando grandes dificultades que se le han presentado y es así como poco a poco ha venido creciendo en ventas. Gracias a su negocio, su esposa y sus 5 hijos han podido ver como su calidad de vida mejora y es por esto que Jose cada vez se esfuerza más para seguir mejorando la calidad de vida en el hogar. Debido a que no cuenta con el capital suficiente, Jose busca un préstamo para comprar productos de la canasta familiar y una estantería para aumentar la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener un gran negocio donde pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas y para que su familia también salga adelante.
texts.en: José opened his general store about 2 years ago seeking to improve his home’s economic situation and to offer greater stability for his family.  Despite not having much capital, his efforts have allowed him to gradually overcome the great difficulties that have arisen and he’s thus been gradually expanding sales.  Thanks to his business, his wife and five children have been able to see their quality of life improve and this is why José strives more every day to continue improving his home’s quality of life.  Because he lacks sufficient capital, José seeks a loan to buy basic staples and a display case to increase the variety of products he stocks for his customers.  His greatest dream is to be able to have a business where he can generate employment for the neediest people and so that his family can also move forward.

loans.use: to buy basic staples and a display case.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en:
Modesto is a father who runs a hog-raising business in his community to gain income for his family. He is 30 years old, married and has one infant child.  He and his wife aim to increase their income so that they can improve their house and save for the future of their child. In this regard, they plan to raise more piglets and chickens to sell in the future. 

Due to insufficient capital, Modesto is asking for a loan of PHP 33,000 to buy feed, vitamins, piglets and materials needed to improve the pigpen. They are hoping that this loan will make it possible for them to improve the business as they continue to work hard and strive for their goal.

loans.use: buy pig feed, vitamins, piglets and to repair his pigpen

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children.  She is from Getafe, Talibon, Bohol, Philippines.  Julieta has owned a motorcycle transport business for seven years now. This is used to transport passengers going from one place to another.

Julieta is in need of financial resources for her motorcycle. She is asking for a loan worth 5000 PHP to buy fuel and spare parts, and to pay for the repair and maintenance of the motorcycle.

In the future, Julieta wants to invest in new ventures to enhance her income so that she can continually support her children for their education.

loans.use: buy fuel, spare parts and repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is married and has seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  She is 47 years old and has five children who are in school.

Lucy has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 7 years.  She requested a PHP 29500 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

In the future, Lucy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy fish to sell

loans.name: Ma. Sol

texts.en:
Sol is 54 years old and married with 2 children.  She works hard to provide for her family.  Sol runs a general store in the Philippines and has been running it for 10 years.  She also earns an income from a restaurant.   

Sol requested a PHP 50000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell.  She has borrowed and repaid 28 loans from NWTF before this loan.  Sol aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Magnolia

texts.en:
Magnolia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetables vending business in the Philippines.  She  has been in this business for 27 years. She also earns more income from Avon dealing and raising pigs.  Magnolia is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell for her vegetables vending business.  

Magnolia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 3 years.

Ritchel requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items like pants, bags, and other clothing to sell.  In the future, Ritchel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie is a member of PMPC under the micro-finance program.  She is 37 years of age, married and has 7 school-aged children.  She lives in Sabang, Larena, Siquijor.  She has been engaged in a sari-sari store business for 3 years, earning PHP 1,000 a month.  She took a loan from PMPC to purchase additional grocery stocks for resale.  She plans to use the profit to invest more capital into her business and support the needs of her family.

loans.use: restock her grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 40 years old.  She is married and has 3 children currently in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marlyn runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, canned goods, egg, spices, cooking oil, etc. Marlynn requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell.

In the future, Marlyn would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fishing net for her fishing business.

Perlita has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from raising livestock and selling dried fish.

Perlita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to repair and renovate her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing net for her business

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 54 years old and married with five children. Rosita works very hard to provide for them.

Rosita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store.

Rosita has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, detergent and other groceries. 

In the future Rosita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Jenina

texts.en: Jenina is an active member of PMPC. She is 43 years old and a single mom with three school-age children. She lives in Bitaug, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor. She has been selling fish for four years, earning a daily average income of Php 100. She took her second loan from PMPC to purchase a new weighing scale and fish for the business. She plans to use the profit to support her children's need.

loans.use: to purchase a scale and fish to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 54 years old and widowed with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items such as rice, soft-drinks and other groceries.

Susan has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 12 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Susan aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items such as rice, soft-drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Luis Argemiro

texts.es:
Luis es una persona muy trabajadora que ha sacado con gran esfuerzo su cafetería adelante, y pese a las grandes adversidades que se le han presentado, siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para superarlas y continuar progresando junto a su familia. Hace un tiempo su municipio fue víctima de un gran conflicto de violencia, y esto hizo que desde entonces sus ventas se vieran fuertemente perjudicadas, lo que a su vez hace que sus ingresos para el hogar no sean suficientes. Pero con mucho empeño ha venido sacando su negocio adelante y ahora que sus ventas están mejorando busca un préstamo para comprar surtido para su cafetería.

Su sueño es comprar su propio local y poder ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis is a very hardworking person who, after much effort, has been able to make his café successful, and despite the great challenges that he has faced, he has been strong enough to overcome them and continue prospering alongside his family. Some time ago, his municipality was the center of a violent conflict, which seriously hurt business and in turn, made Luis' earnings insufficient. However, through a lot of hard work and determination, he has been able to keep his business afloat, and now that sales are improving, he is seeking a loan to restock his café.

His dream is to be able to buy his own business space and offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase goods to restock his café.

loans.name: Luz Adriana

texts.es:
Luz Adriana inició hace unos 3 años su propio negocio con el objetivo de generar ingresos para contribuir económicamente junto con su esposo en la generación de ingresos para el hogar y poderles ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a sus 4 hijos. El negocio comenzó como un cibercafé donde ofrecía solo el servicio de Internet, pero gracias a requerimientos de sus clientes, ahora tiene una venta de celulares y accesorios para celulares. Desde que tiene su negocio las dificultades económicas de su hogar han podido irse superando y espera que así continúe para que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida. Buscando responder a los pedidos de sus clientes, Luz Adriana busca un préstamo para comprar accesorios para celulares y así mejorar sus ventas.

Su sueño es sacar adelante este negocio, que le permita en un futuro conseguir su casa propia y también ofrecerles a sus 4 hijos el acceso una mejor educación.
texts.en:
Luz Adriana started her own business three years ago, with the aim of generating income. This is so that she can contribute financially, along with her husband, to the household income, and provide a better quality of life to their four children. 

The business began as an Internet café, where she provided just Internet service, but because of the needs of her customers, she now sells cell phones and cell phone accessories. Since she has had her business, the financial difficulties of her household have gradually been overcome. 

She hopes to continue in this way, so that her family will have a better quality of life. To deal with her customer orders, Luz Adriana is seeking a loan to buy cell phone accessories, and this way improve her sales. 

Her dream is to make this business succeed, which will allow her to get her own house someday and also provide her four children with access to a better education.

loans.use: To buy cell phone accessories, and this way improve her sales.

loans.name: Ana Marleny

texts.es:
Desde hace 15 años Ana Marleny montó su tienda general desde su propia casa con el ánimo de ayudar en su hogar económicamente, pues los ingresos que genera su esposo no son suficientes para el sostenimiento de sus 4 hijos. A pesar de las grandes dificultades económicas que ha tenido, su esfuerzo le permite salir adelante y continuar luchando para sacar su familia adelante y ofrecer en su hogar una mejor calidad de vida. Gracias a que en los últimos meses ha venido teniendo mejores ventas, Ana Marleny busca un préstamo que le permita comprar productos de la canasta familiar para aumentar la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes.

Ana Marleny sueña con tener un minimercado donde pueda generar empleo y desde el cual sus ingresos aumenten para ofrecerles a sus 4 hijos una mejor educación.
texts.en: Ana Marleny opened her general store at home 15 years ago aiming at helping her home economically because the income generated by her husband was insufficient to support their four children.  Despite the great economic  difficulties she’s had, her efforts have made it possible for her to move forward and to continue to strive to move her family forward and provide her home with better quality of life.  Thanks to improved sales in recent months, Ana Marleny is looking for financing to buy basic staples to increase the variety of products available for her customers.  Ana Marleny dreams with having a minimart to generate employment and increase her income to offer her four children a better education.

loans.use: to buy basic staples.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar trabajó durante 12 años en la actividad de las ventas en diferentes empresas, y desde hace 1 año decidió independizarse y comenzar a vender por su propia cuenta productos de uso personal. Desde entonces, ha podido venir trabajando en mejores condiciones y sus ingresos a pesar de no ser los mejores, han podido irle cubriendo sus gastos y los de la familia. La principal ventaja que tiene es que ha conservado los clientes que tenía cuando trabajaba para una empresa, pero la dificultad es el poco capital con el que cuenta que hace que su negocio a menudo no pueda responder ante los grandes pedidos de sus clientes. Es por esto que Edgar busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal y surtir su negocio para responder a los pedidos de sus clientes.

Edgar aspira a poder seguir creciendo con el negocio y abrir más sectores donde comercializa sus productos.
texts.en: Edgar worked as a salesman for various firms for 12 years and a year ago decided to become independent and start to sell personal use products on his own.  Since then, he’s been able to work in better conditions and his income, despite not being the best, has been enough to cover his and his family’s expenses.  His main advantage is that he’s retained the customers he’d gotten back when he was employed by a firm but the difficulty is the small amount of capital he has which often causes his business to be unable to respond to large customer orders.  This is why Edgar is looking for a loan to buy personal use products to stock his business and be able to fill customer orders.  Edgar hopes to continue growing with the business and to open more sectors where he can sell his products.

loans.use: to buy personal use products to fill pending customer orders.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: María del Rosario de 58 años, ha optado mas en seguir haciendo fritanga todas las noches una comida típica del país y almuerzos, siendo sus principales compradores los vecinos, el cual dicho negocio es el medio principal para seguirle brindando apoyo a sus dos hijos, uno de ellos todavía está estudiando en la secundaria, con quienes han sabido ingeniárselas para salir adelante ya que María es viuda y no tiene otro apoyo económico. Con este cuarto crédito comprara un mostrador de comida y productos como arroz, aceite, carnes, verduras, pollo y frutas para hacer refrescos. Sus planes para un futuro es tener su comedor abierto las 24 horas y poder contratar más trabajadores.
texts.en: María del Rosario, 58, has opted to continue working selling ‘fritanga’ [Nicaraguan fast-food] every night, a traditional food of the country, and lunches.  Her main buyers are neighbors.  Her business is the main source of income to continue supporting her two children.  One of them is still attending secondary school.  She and her children have figured out ways to get ahead together since María is a widow and has no other economic support.  With this fourth loan she will buy a food display case and products like rice, oil, meat, vegetables, chicken and fruit to make refreshments.  Her future plan is to have an eatery that’s open 24 hours and to be able to hire more workers.

loans.use: to buy a food display case and products like rice, oil, meat, vegetables, chicken and fruit.

loans.name: Gilberto David

texts.es:
Gilberto es una persona muy trabajadora que ha logrado sacar adelante su propio cultivo de verduras. La actividad de la agricultura la aprendió de un vecino suyo quién se la enseñó y le brindó empleo durante un año aproximadamente, y desde hace un tiempo buscando mejorar sus ingresos, Gilberto decidió sacar adelante su propio cultivo. La principal dificultad que tiene es que está separado de la madre de sus hijos y sus 2 hijos dependen económicamente de el, lo que hace muy difícil la situación económica del hogar. Pero con su cultivo espera poder mejorar esta situación y es por esto que Gilberto busca un préstamo para instalar un sistema de riego en su cultivo, lo que le permita aumentar su productividad y por tanto vender más.

Su sueño es poder tener los recursos económicos suficientes para brindarles educación a sus 2 hijos de 1 y 5 años de edad.
texts.en:
Gilberto is a very hardworking person who has been able to successfully grow his own vegetable crops. He learned farming from a neighbor who taught him how to cultivate, and then gave him work for approximately one year. Some time ago, in an effort to increase his income, Gilberto decided to start growing his own crops. His main challenge is that he is separated from the mother of his two children, who depend on him financially, and this makes his household financial situation difficult. Nevertheless, with his crops, he hopes to be able to improve this situation, which is why Gilberto is now requesting this loan in order to install an irrigation system for his crops. This system will increase his crops, which will in turn allow him to sell more produce.

His dream is to be able to have the financial resources needed to provide his children, ages 1 and 5, with a good education.

loans.use: to install a crop irrigation system.

loans.name: Argiro De Jesus

texts.es:
Argiro tiene una experiencia de más de 30 años trabajando la venta de productos de manera ambulante, y desde hace 12 años gracias a un apoyo logró ubicarse en un local donde actualmente sigue teniendo su venta de productos de consumo. Pese a no contar con mucho capital su negocio ha podido ir saliendo adelante gracias a su esfuerzo, y debido a que ahora está teniendo buenas ventas, Argiro busca un préstamo para comprar snack, gaseosas, dulces, entre otros y ofrecer un mejor surtido a sus clientes.

De esta manera podrá mejorar sus ingresos y también mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposa y su hijo, pues de este negocio depende su familia. Su sueño es tener una casa propia y también un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
Argiro has more than 30 years of experience working as a traveling salesman, and 12 years ago, thanks to some support, he was empowered to set up a shop where he currently continues selling his products.  In spite of not having much capital, his business has been able to get ahead thanks to his effort, and since now he has good sales, Argiro is looking for a loan to purchase snacks, soft drinks, sweets and other products to offer a better selection to his customers. 

In this way, he will be able to improve his income and also the quality of life of his wife and their child, since his family depends on this business.  His dream is to have his own home and also a larger business.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, soft drinks, sweets and other products to offer a better selection to his customers.

loans.name: Rica

texts.en:
Rica is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell for her vegetables vending business.

Rica has been in this business for 10 years.  She earns more income from a general store.

Rica has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is a father who is raising his family in a rural community. He is a farmer who manages his farm land by planting corn, vegetables and raising  livestock for sale. Due to insufficient income, he also involved in a citrus plantation to have another source of income. He aims to increase his production and income to satisfy his family needs and finance the education of his children. 

Despite financial difficulty, Rodrigo has the determination to continue sending his children to school, for he wants them to become professionals in the future. To improve his farming business, he is asking for an additional capital of PHP 25,000 to buy fertilizer and insecticides for the maintenance of his citrus plantation. He believes that the loan will make it possible for him to improve his farming business and he is hoping that he will become financially stable in the future.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Lino

texts.en:
Lino is a 53-year-ld fisherman from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. He is married and has two children ages 14 and 12.

Lino has been in the fishing business for more than eight years now.  He is asking for a new loan worth 14000 PHP to buy fishing nets, lead weights, fuel for the boat, and cement for his house renovation.

Lino joined CEVI several years ago because he likes the services offered by the organization such as loans and insurance to the micro entrepreneurs like him.   In the future, Lino dreamed of making his fishing business a success and continually support the schooling of his children.

loans.use: pay for fishing nets, lead weights, fuel for the boat, and cement for his house

loans.name: Jeana

texts.en:
Jeana is an active micro-finance member of PMPC since 2011.  She is a widow with 1 adult-aged and 2 school-aged children.  She lives in Bontod, Larena, Siquijor.  

Jeana has been engaged in a piggery business for over 20 years, with a monthly average earnings of PHP 10,000.  She took a loan from PMPC to purchase feed for her pigs.  A portion of the loan will be used for financial assistance for her daughter to work abroad. She hopes that someday the living condition of the family will be improved.

loans.use: buy pig feed and help her daughter to get work abroad

loans.name: Laura Cecilia

texts.es:
Laura es una joven emprendedora de 19 años de edad quien desde que estaba en el colegio vendía dulces para generar sus propios ingresos y ayudar en su hogar con los gastos, pues su familia tiene grandes dificultades económicas. Hace un tiempo comenzó a trabajar con una familiar suya quien ofrecía productos de uso personal, y con la experiencia aprendida Laura decidió comenzar a trabajar de manera independiente. Con unos pequeños ahorros comenzó su negocio el cual ahora ha venido creciendo, y es por esto que Laura como no cuenta con mucho capital, busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal como lociones, cremas, entre otros y responder a los pedidos que tiene.

Su sueño es poder tener su propio negocio de venta de ropa.
texts.en:
At just 19 years of age, Laura is a young entrepreneur who, from the time she was in grade school, used to sell candy in order to make her own money and help out with the family expenses because of financial difficulties. Some time ago, Laura started working with a relative of hers who sells personal care products. With the experience she gained, Laura decided to work for herself. With her modest savings, she launched her business, which is now growing. Because Laura does not have much capital, she is requesting a loan so that she can purchase personal care products like lotion, face cream, and other goods. This way, she can fill the orders she has.

Her dream is to be able to launch her own clothing business.

loans.use: to purchase personal care products like lotion, face cream, and other goods.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen de 34 años convive con Sajid, con quien tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 6 años. Esta familia vive en una casa propia que adquirieron con mucho esfuerzo. Carmen es una mujer dulce. Se dedica a brindar servicios de lavandería en su establecimiento que funciona hace 12 años. 
Ella trabaja de lunes a sábados, y todos los días cuenta con personas que visitan su local con sus prendas de vestir para realizar el lavado.
“Todos los días se ensucia la ropa, por eso siempre hay atención y me va bien”, comenta de buen humor.
Cuando empezó el negocio contaba con una máquina, ahora tiene 3, y una nueva que le sirve para realizar lavados “al seco”. Por ello tuvo que contratar a una persona, para que la apoye en sus labores. 
Como las lavadoras siempre están en uso, necesitan el mantenimiento correspondiente cada cierto tiempo, por eso Carmen solicita de su apoyo para realizar esta tarea. Éste es su crédito número 3 con MFP, por eso se compromete en pagar las cuotas con puntualidad. Está contenta con el sistema de trabajo y con sus compañeros del banco comunal “Los Pioneros de Capelo”, porque son muy sociables. 
Invertirá el dinero en el pago del mantenimiento de sus lavadoras. Destinará como 1000 soles  en ello, y lo sobrante le servirá para adquirir detergentes y otros insumos.
texts.en:
Carman, 34, lives with Sajid; they have two children who are 10 and 6 years old.  This family lives in a house of their own that they acquired with much effort.  Carmen is a sweet woman.  She provides laundry services in her establishment that’s been in operation 12 years.  She works Monday to Saturday and people come by every day to leave their clothes to be laundered.  “Clothes get dirty every day so there’s always work to be done and I do very well,” she comments humorously.  When she opened the business she had only one machine, now she has three including a new one that allows her to do “dry cleaning.”  She had to hire someone to help her do the work.

Because the washing machines are in constant use, they need maintenance in regular intervals which is why Carmen is asking for help to carry out this task.  This is her third MFP loan and she commits to make her installment payments punctually.  She’s happy with the way of working and with her fellow members in the “Los Pioneros de Capelo” communal bank because they are very sociable.

She will use the money to pay to have her washing machines serviced.  She will spend about 1,000 soles on that and will use the rest to buy detergent and other supplies.

loans.use: to service her washing machines and to buy detergent..

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Farmers aim to have high production and income to support their families. Like wise, Romeo aims to improve his vegetable production business to generate sufficient income to satisfy his family needs and support the education of his children. He wants to educate his four children so that they will be the ones to help him when he gets old. Despite the hardship of living, Romeo has the strong faith and determination to uplift their status of living to give his children a better life. 

To increase his production, Romeo plans to expand his vegetable plantation to ensure a high production. He is asking for an additional capital of PHP 41,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides needed in vegetable production. He mentioned that this financial support will be a great help for him to improve his crop production and hopes that he will be having a plentiful harvest.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora has been an active member of PMPC since 2011.  She is 53 years old, married, and has 5 adult children.  The primary livelihood for her family is fishing,  which is primarily operated by her husband for over 10 years.  She took a loan from PMPC to purchase fishing gear like fishing nets and hooks.  She believes that someday the living condition of the family will be improved with God's help.

loans.use: buy fishing gear

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is 54 years old, married and has two grown-up children. He owns and manages a citrus and banana plantation in his community. This is one of the major source of his income. He has been managing this business for almost 10 years and usually earns a profits of PHP 25,000 in every harvest season. He usually spends his income for his family's daily consumption and allowances for his children in school. 

Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Rogelio needs to earn a higher income to cover their necessities and support the education of his youngest child. He plans to improve his crop production by planting more citrus and banana trees. To work out his plan, he is asking for a financial support amounting to PHP 35,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pay the labor cost incurred in planting and clear-brushing the citrus plantation. He is hoping that someday, he will improve his plantation and increase his production.

loans.use: buy pay for fertilizers, insecticides, and labor

loans.name: Roly

texts.es:
Roly, de 39 años, es una mujer emprendedora y amante del trabajo, convive desde hace algunos años con Leonilde quien es el padre de sus 3 hijas y junto a toda su familia vive en su casa propia luchando a diario para salir adelante y mejorar su nivel de vida. Roly, tiene como actividad principal la venta de esteras. Tiene instalado un taller rudimentario de fabricación de este producto y continuamente elaboran la cantidad necesaria para poder venderlos. Generalmente sus ventas son hechas por pedidos anticipados cuya cantidad en volumen siempre favorece su economía. La materia prima lo obtiene de aserraderos quienes le ofertan a precios cómodos los rastrojos maderables que recicla para confeccionar las esteras. Todo el proceso de fabricación es manual. Lleva en este negocio cerca de 3 años y trabaja con la ayuda de su cónyuge. Le apasiona el trabajo que realiza porque siente que con ello contribuye a la conservación del medio ambiente, además le agrada saber que con esta labor puede obtener los ingresos económicos que necesita para apalear los gastos básicos de su familia. Espera pode implementar un taller semi-industrial donde elabore esteras de mejor acabado. Este es el crédito número 10 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su acceso a este financiamiento ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de forma puntual, del mismo modo se siente muy tranquila y respaldada por los integrantes de su banco comunal.
Con el préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles, aumentará el capital que requiere para comprar mas restos de madera para elaborar esteras.
texts.en:
Roly, 39, is an enterprising woman who loves to work.  She has lived for several years with Leonilde, the father of her three daughters.  Together they live in their own house, striving every day to get ahead and improve their living conditions.

Roly works selling mats.  She has a rudimentary shop for making this product and continually makes the necessary number to sell.  Generally her sales are based on previous orders, and the wholesale price is always favorable for her.  She gets her materials from sawmills that give her a good price for the leftover timber, which she recycles to make her mats.

The entire fabrication process is manual.  She has done this work for about three years and she works with the help of her husband.

She's passionate about the work she does because she feels that with it she contributes to preserving the environment.  Also, she's happy to know that with this job she can earn the income she needs to help with her family's basic expenses.  She hopes she can set up a semi-industrial shop to make mats with a better finish.

This is her tenth loan with MFP.  She's grateful to the people who make it possible for her to get this financing because she'll always feel more secure about advancing in her job.  Also, she pledges to make her payments punctually.  She also feels calm, and supported by the members of her communal bank.

With the loan for 1000 nuevos soles [PEN] she'll increase the capital she needs to buy leftover wood to make mats.

loans.use: to buy leftover wood to make mats

loans.name: Dione Estella

texts.es:
Dione aprendió la actividad de elaboración de artículos decorativos artesanales y así decora prendas de vestir. La actividad la aprendió hace unos 16 años y durante 10 años trabajó como empleada. Debido a que su esposo murió, Dione hace un tiempo ha quedado viuda y por esto tuvo que dejar su empleo para poder cuidar a sus 4 hijos, pero por la necesidad de generar los ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar, con unos pequeños ahorros montó su negocio desde su casa y ahora trabaja de manera independiente. A pesar de que hace tan solo 1 año que inició con su negocio desde el hogar, y que no cuenta con un gran capital disponible, la buena calidad de sus trabajos le han permitido salir adelante y ahora tiene la oportunidad de generar 2 empleos en su negocio. Buscando superar sus dificultades económicas para responder a los pedidos, Dione busca un préstamo para comprar materias primas como piedras, alambre, hilos, siliconas, cintas, entre otros, y responder a grandes pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.

Su sueño es sacar adelante este negocio y tener un local comercial donde pueda ofrecer más productos, además de seguir ofreciendo una buena educación a sus 4 hijos y en un futuro lograr conseguir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Dione learned to make decorative craft articles and decorate articles of clothing. She learned the business around 16 years ago, and for 10 years worked as an employee. 

Due to the fact that her husband died, Dione was left a widow some time ago, and for this reason, had to leave her job in order to be able to look after her four children. But because of the need to generate the income to support her household, she used some small savings to set up a home business and now works independently. 

Despite the fact that she started her home business only a year ago, and doesn't have a great deal of working capital at her disposal, the good quality of her work has allowed her to succeed, and she now has the opportunity to generate two jobs in her business. 

Seeking to overcome her financial difficulties in dealing with orders, Dione is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as stones, wire, thread, silicone, ribbons, and other materials, so that she can deal with the large orders she has from her customers.

Her dream is to make this business succeed, and have a shop where she can offer more products, besides continuing to provide a good education to her four children, and managing to get her own house someday.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as stones, wire, thread, silicone, ribbons, and other materials, so that she can deal with the large orders she has from her customers.

loans.name: Anita Andrea

texts.es: La señora Anita es una persona responsable, la señora Anita es viuda, tiene 5 hijos los cuales son menores de edad, uno de 14, el segundo de 11, el tercero de 8, el cuarto de 6 y el ultimo de 4 años, la señora se dedica tanto a la venta de ropa como a la agricultura ella cuenta actualmente con 2 hectáreas de plátano de los cuales apenas le alcanza para llevar el pan a la casa, ella los fines de semana abre su pequeña venta de ropa abierta al publico en la localidad de Israel, su hijo mayor es el que ayuda los fines de semana y los días que puede en el chaco, actualmente la señora quiere incrementar sus plantaciones para así poder generar un poco mas de ingresos y poder sustentar a su familia y en un futuro muy cercado darles algunas comodidades, la señora Anita necesita comprar insumos agrícolas y abono orgánico, para incrementar sus cultivos y darles una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Anita is a responsible person. Anita is a widow, and has five children who are minors: one is 14, the second is 11, the third is 8, the fourth is 6, and the youngest is 4. 

She sells clothing and also farms. She currently has two hectares of plantains, which is barely enough for her to support the household. On weekends she opens her small clothing stand to the public in the Israel neighborhood. Her eldest son helps her on weekends, and in the fields on the days he can. 

Now she wants to increase her plantings so that she can generate a bit more income and be able to support her family, and in the very near future provide them with some home comforts. 

Anita needs to buy agricultural supplies and organic fertilizer, in order to increase her crops and provide her children with a better life.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria aprendió la actividad trabajando en restaurantes durante unos 20 años, y hace un tiempo decidió montar su propio negocio con unos pequeños ahorros que tenía para poder trabajar mejor y mejorar sus ingresos. La gran dificultad que tiene es la parte económica que se complica por el hecho de haber quedado viuda y tener que responder por sus 2 hijos, pero para esto siempre ha trabajado fuertemente y espera mejorar la situación. Buscando ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, Maria busca un préstamo para comprar insumos para la preparación de las comidas y también cambiar las mesas y las sillas del negocio por unas en mejor estado.

Su sueño es poder salir adelante con su propio restaurante y mejorar sus ingresos para que en su hogar pueda tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: María learned her activity working in restaurants for about 20 years and some time ago decided to open her own business using a little savings she had in order to work better and improve her income.  Her greatest problem is economic which is made worse by her having been widowed and having to be responsible for her two children but she’s always worked hard for this and she expects to improve the situation.  She wants to offer better customer service so is looking for a loan to buy ingredients to prepare the food and also to replace the tables and chairs which are in poor shape.  Her dream is to get ahead with her own restaurant and to improve her income so that there will be better quality of life at home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the meals and to replace the tables and chairs.

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es:
Claudia fue abandonada por el padre de su hijo de 5 años de edad desde hace un tiempo, y debido a que tenía que responder con las obligaciones del hogar comenzó a buscar maneras de generar los ingresos que necesitaba. Fue así como aprovechó algunos conocimientos que tenía en la actividad de los cibercafé y con unos pequeños ahorros comenzó su propio negocio. Como no tenía mucho capital, el negocio ha tenido que verse retrazado en algunas herramientas que necesita, pero con su esfuerzo ha podido irlo sacando adelante. Claudia ahora busca poder aprovechar que tiene buenas ventas y así poder buscar un préstamo para comprar un nuevo computador para aumentar la capacidad que tiene para atender a los clientes.

Su sueño es poder tener un buen negocio que le permita tener mejores ingresos. Además sueña con conseguirse su casa propia y poderle brindar a su hijo una buena educación.
texts.en: Claudia was abandoned by the father of her five-year-old son some time ago and because of this she had to take on the obligations at home and started to look for ways of generating the income she needed.  This is how she availed herself of some skills she had in the Internet café realm and using some savings she had she started her own business.  Since she did not have much capital, the business has lagged behind with some of the tools it requires but with her efforts she’s been gradually moving it forward.  Now Claudia wants to take advantage of the good sales she’s had to find a loan to buy a new computer to increase her capacity for customer service.   Her dream is to have a good business that will produce higher income.  She also dreams with getting a house of her own and to be able to provide her son with a good education.

loans.use: to buy a new computer.

loans.name: Maria Silvana

texts.es:
Maria es una persona muy trabajadora que ha tenido que atravesar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido una gran fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia. Desde hace un tiempo el padre de su hijo la abandonó y desde entonces ha quedado a cargo de todas las responsabilidades del hogar, y durante un tiempo tuvo un empleo con el cual pagaba todos los gastos pero hace unos años el negocio se acabó y las dificultades económicas comenzaron a aparecer. Fue así como montó una tienda general donde ofrece a sus clientes productos de la canasta familiar, y gracias a esta tienda ha podido venir generando los ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Buscando superar la dificultad de capital que tiene, Maria requiere un préstamo para comprar productos de la canasta familiar y surtir su negocio para aumentar las ventas.

Su sueño es sacar este negocio adelante y poder ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
María is a very hardworking person who has experienced a lot of adversity in her life.  Nevertheless, she always has had great strength for getting ahead and continuing to move forward with her family.

Some time ago the father of her son abandoned her and since then she has been responsible for the household.  For a time she had a job with which she paid for all her expenses, but a few years ago the business closed and her financial difficulties began.

That was how she started a general store where she sells her customers products from the family shopping basket.  Thanks to this store she has been able to generate the income to support her household.

Hoping to overcome her problem with capital, María needs a loan to buy basic household necessities and stock her store to increase sales.

Her dream is to get her business ahead and be able to give her son a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic household necessities to stock her store

loans.name: Yenny Maria

texts.es:
Yenny es una persona muy trabajadora que apoya económicamente en su hogar para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida para su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Como tenía conocimiento de trabajos anteriores, Yenny un día decidió comenzar a vender productos de uso personal y con esto ha venido mejorando los ingresos de la familia. Sin embargo, como no cuenta con mucho capital ha tenido que ver como no puede responder a grandes pedidos, pues no tiene con qué surtir. Buscando mejorar esta situación, Yenny busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal y responder a los grandes pedidos de sus clientes.

Su sueño es poder sacar adelante este negocio y mejorar sus ingresos para que en su hogar su esposo y sus 2 hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en: Yenny’s a very hardworking person who contributes economically to her home in order to have better quality of life for her husband and two children.  With skills learned in previous jobs, Yenny decided to start selling personal use products and has gradually been improving her family’s income this way.  However, since she does not have much capital she’s not been able to respond to large customer orders because she lacks stock with which to fill them.  Seeking to improve this situation, Yenny is looking for a loan to buy personal use products to respond to large customer orders.  Her dream is to move the business forward and to improve her income so that her home, husband and two children will have better quality of life and improved opportunities for economic progress.

loans.use: to buy personal use products.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro de 60 años, está casado con Odilia. Tiene 5 hijos pero ya no viven con él. Pedro habita una casa propia, que adquirió por herencia de sus padres. Pedro es un hombre persistente. Hace más de 20 años abrió un puesto de ventas de comida en el mercado de su localidad. Ahí expende alimentos desde las 5 de la tarde, hasta la media noche. Él y su esposa s e encargan de preparar caldos de gallina, de cordero, y otros platos.
“El trabajo es de todo el día, por las mañanas salimos ha hacer las compras de los ingredientes y luego empezamos a cocinar”, menciona.
En todo este tiempo consolidó clientes fieles. Además menciona que la mayor clientela que tiene, llega a partir de las 10 de la noche. “Aquí vienen vigilantes, policías, estudiantes, comerciantes, porque a esas horas de la noche no encuentran restaurantes abiertos”, agrega.
Entre sus planes más cercanos está adquirir nuevas ollas, y utensilios, para atender mejor a sus clientes. Éste es su préstamo número 12 con MFP. En todo este tiempo mostró ser un cliente puntual en sus pagos y responsable dentro de las actividades de su banco comunal “Los Pioneros de Capelo”, con quienes se siente muy a gusto. Con el dinero podrá adquirir ingredientes para preparar los alimentos que expende como: kilos de carnes y verduras. Con lo sobrante comprará ollas y utensilios nuevos.
texts.en:
Pedro is 60 years old and married to Odilia. He has 5 children, but they no longer live with him.  Pedro lives in his own home that he acquired as an inheritance from his parents.  Pedro is a persistent man.  More than 20 years ago, he opened a food stall in his local market.  There, he sells meals from 5:00 in the afternoon until midnight.  He and his wife are in charge of preparing chicken soup, lamb stew, and other meals.  He mentions "The work is all day: In the morning, we leave to purchase the ingredients and then we begin to cook."  In all this time, he has gathered faithful customers.  Also, he mentions that the majority of his customers arrive starting at 10:00pm.  "Police officers, guards, students, and business people all come here, because at these hours of the night, they can't find restaurants open." he adds.

Among his short term plans are acquiring new pots and utensils to better tend to his customers.  This is his 12th loan with MFP.  In all this time, he has proved himself to be punctual with his payments and responsible with the activities of his communal bank "Los Pioneros de Capelo”, with which he feels very satisfied.  With the money, he will be able to obtain ingredients to prepare the food that he sells such as meat and vegetables.  With what is leftover, he will purchase pots and new utensils.

loans.use: to purchase meats and vegetables, as well as pots and new utensils.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales,la socia cria gallos y gallinas,la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito de chinchero,la socia se dedica a este 5 años y le va muy bien y esta contenta con su trabajo ,la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar gallos y gallinas al por mayor.
texts.en: She continues with her business raising animals; she raises chickens and roosters.  She fattens them up and then sells them in various street markets in Chinchero District.  She’s been in business five years and does very well.  She’s happy with her work and works from 9am until 6pm.  Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell her animals.  She needs the loan to buy chickens and roosters at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy chickens and roosters at wholesale.

loans.name: Virgen De Bronce  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Virgen de Bronce esta conformado por 8 señoras que viven por diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, son amigas y conocidas que tienen una gran amistad, comparten los mismos ideales que es mejorar su economía y sacar adelante a sus familias a base de su esfuerzo y trabajo arduo que realizan diariamente en sus diferentes negocios. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que tiene un clima frió, esta bañada por 4 ríos los que le dan el nombre de Santa Ana de los 4 Ríos, desde Diciembre de 1999 es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, tiene varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza,  de su gastronomía y de su cultura.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Gladys, se encuentra realizando su primer crédito en la banca comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga quien ya es socia activa.  Vive por la parroquia de Baños en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y ha concebido dos hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad que están estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora como albañil, no tienen casa propia aun por lo que viven en una casa prestada por un familiar.

Doña Gladys trabaja lavando ropa ajena actividad que la desempeña hace 5 años,  trabaja de lunes a viernes sin un horario, también arregla varias casas pero solo algunos días de la semana y el tiempo que le queda le dedica a su familia y hogar.
 
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra  de útiles escolares y uniformes para sus hijos y víveres de su hogar.
 
Su sueño es tener una casita propia.
texts.en:
The “Virgen de Bronce” communal bank has 8 ladies who live in various parts of Cuenca; they are friends and acquaintances who share a great friendship and the same ideals which are to improve their economy and move their families forward based on hard work and the effort they expend daily in their various businesses.  They live in various parts of Cuenca, a cold climate city, bathed by four rivers which give it its name of “Santa Ana de los Cuatro Ríos.”  Since December, 1999, it’s been a Cultural Patrimony of Humanity.  It has several places to enjoy nature, its cuisine and its culture.

Gladys is one of the members.  She’s taking out her first loan with the communal bank having been invited to join by a girlfriend who is an active member of it already.  She lives in Baños Parish in the city of Cuenca.  She’s 28-years-old, married and has two children who are 10 and 8 years old and attend the local little elementary school.  Her husband works in construction.  They do not own a house; they live in a house lent to them by a relative.

Gladys works taking in laundry for others, an activity she’s been doing for five years.  She works Monday to Friday with no set schedule.  She also does housework in several houses but only on some days of the week.  Any time she has left over she dedicated to her family and her home.

She will use her loan to buy school supplies and uniforms for her children and groceries for her home.  Her dream is to own a little house.

loans.use: to buy school uniforms, school supplies and foodstuffs.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y aceite,la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia se dedica a este negocio 10 años y le va muy bien,en sus tiempos libres a la socia le gusta salir a pasear con sus hijos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y aceite al por mayor.

La socia esta agradecida con el credito y se compromete a pagar con sus cuotas
texts.en: She continues with her business selling basic staples like rice, sugar, milk and oil from 6am until 9pm.  She supports her children by means of this business.  She’s been in business ten years and does very well.   In her free time she likes going out on excursions with her children.  She requests the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and oil at wholesale.  She’s grateful for the loan and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and oil at wholesale.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita, a 59-year-old married mother of three children, lives in Talibon, Bohol, Philippines where she has been engaged in a fish-vending business for more than 20 years now. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Lolita is requesting a loan worth 6000 PHP to buy fishing nets, lead weights and fuel for the boat. With these, her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch, thus giving her more fish to sell in the market.

Lolita hopes to make her business a success and experience the fullness of life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights and fuel for the boat.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida y elaboracion de chicha,ella elabora la chicha que es una bebida a base de maiz,la socia tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de cuyes,chanchos y gallinas,la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,la socia en el negocio de venta de comida y elaboracion de chicha ya tiene 6 años y en el negocio de crianza de animales tiene 5 años,el sueño de la socia es ampliar sus pequeños negocios y tener local donde pueda vender los animales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar animales como cuyes,gallinas y chanchos al por mayor y tambien comida para los animales.

La socia agradece por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en: She continues in her business selling food and making ‘chicha,’ a corn-based beverage.  She also continues raising guinea pigs, pigs and chickens.  She fattens them up and then sells them in various street markets.  She’s been in the food and chicha making business for six years and has been raising animals for five years.  Her dream is to expand her small businesses and to have a locale where she can sell her animals in.  She’s asking for a loan to buy animals like guinea pigs, chickens and pigs at wholesale as well as to buy feed for them.  She is grateful for the granted loan and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy small farm animals like guinea pigs, chickens and pigs as well as feed for them.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al trabajo como abogada,ella tiene un consultorio donde presta servicios a sus clientes,la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 13 años en este trbajo y por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos y su sueño es que ellos sean profesionales y terminen de estudiar.La socia solicita el credito para comprar un escritorio para implementar su consultorio de abogada.

La socia esta agradeciada con el credito otorgado y se comprete a pagar con las cuotas.
texts.en: She continues working as an attorney.  She has an office where she offers services for her customers.  She works nine to five and has 13 years’ experience in this occupation.  She supports her children by means of this work and her dream is that they become professionals and complete their education.  She requests the loan to buy a desk to furnish her law office.  She’s grateful for the granted loan and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy a desk for her office.

loans.name: Luz Dina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de brindar servicio de turismo,la socia vende servicio  a los diferentes turistas y le gusta este negocio,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio,en sus tiempos libres a la socia le gusta preparar postres con sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el servicio de turismo.La socia solicita el credito para comprar carpas,sleping y herramientas.

La socia esta agradecida con el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Luz Dina is continuing with her business providing tourism services.  She sells her services to various tourists, and she enjoys the business.  She already has 8 years of experience with this business. In her free time, she enjoys preparing desserts with her children.  Luz Dina's dream is to expand her tourism business.  She is requesting a loan to buy tents, sleeping bags and tools.

Luz Dina is grateful for the loan that is being granted, and she promises to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy tents, sleeping bags and tools

loans.name: Maria Roxana

texts.es:
La socia Maria Roxana pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE IV, la socia continua trabajando como docente en uno de los colegios de Cusco,la socia lleva años ejerciendo su carrera el cual le trae satisfaciones tanto economicas como personales,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia,a la vez la socia continua dedicandose al negocio de venta de ropa este negocio lo realiza en sus tiempos libres,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma poder seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de casacas para su negocio.
texts.en: María Roxana is a member of the “Comuzone IV” communal bank and continues working as a teacher in a school in Cusco.  She’s been working in her profession for years and it provides much satisfaction for her both economically and personally.  She’s a responsible, dedicated person and she supports her family this way.  At the same time she continues working selling clothes in her free time and wants to be able to continue to do so to be able to continue supporting her family.  She requests the loan to buy coats for her business.

loans.use: to buy coats.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma, tiene 43 años, es una mujer alegre, emprendedora y muy trabajadora, está casada con Pedro quien es el padre de sus 5 hijos de 25, 23, 21, 9 y 2 años de edad, todos juntos viven en su casa propia que construyeron hace mucho tiempo y todos luchan por dar lo mejor de sí para salir adelante. La actividad económica de nuestra amiga Vilma consiste en la venta de papaya. Tiene una chacra en donde siembra principalmente este cultivo, además de otros como plátano, maíz y otros cultivos de corto periodo vegetativo. Generalmente cosecha de manera semanal y una vez obtenido la cantidad necesaria traslada todo hasta el puerto fluvial en donde vende por cientos a precios al por mayor. Lleva en esta actividad mas de 10 años y por fortuna desde que empezó le ha ido muy bien aunque reconoce que tuvo que pasar algunos meses para que se acostumbre a la rutina laboral. Trabaja con la ayuda de su esposo y de algunos obreros que contrata dependiendo de la magnitud del trabajo a realizar. Lo que le agrada de su trabajo es la rentabilidad que obtiene por sus ventas, ya que este producto es muy cotizado y solicitado por la población, además al complementarlo con otros productos sus ganancias económicas son siempre favorecidas. Planea obtener un puesto de ventas en algún mercado de la ciudad en donde pueda vender por unidades para ganar aún más. Este es el crédito numero 12 con MFP, por ello se siente agradecida con las personas que le brindan el financiamiento que necesita para que pueda concretar sus planes, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual y espera continuar trabajando con su banco comunal por el compañerismo y la solidaridad que muestran entre ellos cada uno de sus integrantes. Con el préstamo de 800 nuevos soles, contratará el personal necesario para la siembra de maíz que en esta temporada tiene un buen precio de venta.
texts.en: Vilma, age 43, is a cheerful and hardworking female entrepreneur. She is married to Pedro, who is the father of her 5 children ages 25, 23, 21, 9, and 2. They all live in a house that they own, which they built a long time ago, and they all give it their best to get ahead in life. Our friend Vilma sells papayas for a living. She has a small farm in which she cultivates mainly papaya, as well as other crops like plantains, corn, and other short-term produce. She generally harvests her crops on a weekly basis, and once she obtains the amount of produce she needs, she transports it to the river port where she sells it by the hundreds at wholesale prices. She's been in business for over 10 years, and luckily, she has been prosperous, though she admits that she had to let several months go by before she got used to this work routine. She works with the help of her husband and laborers that she hires depending on how big her task is. What she likes about her business is how lucrative it is as this crop is very sought-after by the locals. Furthermore, by offering other crops, her profits are always favorable. She is planning to obtain a stand in a city market where she can sell her produce at retail prices and earn even more money. This is her 12th loan with MFP, which is why she is very grateful to the lenders because she needs this money to realize her plans. She also commits to repaying her loans punctually, and she hopes to continue working with her microfinance bank because of the camaraderie and solidarity that each of its members display. With this 800.00 PEN loan, she will hire the laborers she needs to plant corn, a crop that is quite lucrative during this season.

loans.use: to hire farm laborers for help in planting corn.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: 34-Cielo Radiante - 34 Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento 34-CIELO RADIANTE – 34 está compuesta por ocho integrantes de los cuales seis son mujeres y dos varones que se dedican a distintas actividades, La Sra. María tiene 41 años, es casada con tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo, ella vende sus productos de manera ambulante, visitando domicilios y oficinas públicas y privadas de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. María va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de cosmético y joyas por mayor y que se encuentran en promoción y de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. María va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de productos de belleza, la Sra. María es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella y a sus compañeras de grupo que en muchos casos sacan adelante a su familias solas.
texts.en:
The Entrepreneurship Bank 34 - Cielo Radiante - 34 is composed of eight members, of whom six are women and two are men. They are engaged in various activities. 

María is 41 years old, is married and has three children who are in school age. She is engaged in selling cosmetics by catalog, selling her products as a street peddler. She visits homes and public and private offices in the city of Cochabamba, where she offers her products. 

This loan is her third sequence within the institution. María will use this loan to buy cosmetics and jewelry in bulk and in sale, and thus she provides variety of products to her customers and increases her profits. The reason for applying for this loan is to continue improving in her business. María will use the benefits to keep buying variety of beauty products. 

María is very hard-working, she feels happy for the opportunity given to her and her fellow group members because, in many cases, they get their families ahead alone.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and jewelry in bulk.

loans.name: Kaypacha Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “KAYPACHA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Josefina ella es conviviente y tiene 46 años y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz,azucar,leche,golosinas,gaseosas,entre otros, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia trabaja en su negocio de lunes a domingo desde las 06:00am hasta las 09:00pm aproximadamente aunque este horario puede variar de acuerdo a las actividades que pueda tener en el dia,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como arroz y leche para su negocio.

El persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.

Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de chocolateria, reparaciones de celulares, tienda de abarrotes, costureria, venta de florez, productos de belleza, venta de materiales de construcción.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These individuals belong to the communal bank "Kaypacha."  This bank is located in the Cusco district, which is part of the province and department of Cusco.

Josefina lives with a partner and is 46 years old.  She has 6 children.  She alternates her daily activities with her work in her grocery store business.  She sells a variety of products, such as rice, sugar, milk, candy, soft drinks, and other items.  She has worked for years in this business, and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts into her work each day.  She works every day from 6am until about 9pm; her schedule can vary according to her other daily activities.  

Josefina is a responsible and hardworking person, as this is how she gets ahead with her family.  She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as rice and milk for her business.  

The person in the picture whose face is covered is not a member of this communal bank.  The other members of the group have a variety of businesses including: a chocolate store, cell phone repairs, a grocery store, a dressmaking shop, flower sales, beauty products, and the sale of construction materials.  

Josefina thanks those who are helping her realize her dreams through this loan.  She promises to make her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business, such as rice and milk

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La socia Carmen pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE IV,la socia continua con su negocio de elaboracion de postres ,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia vende de forma independiente y a pedido para los distintos compromisos que le solicitan como matrimonios,fiestas de 15 años entre otros,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de insumos como harina,azucar,leche entre otros.
texts.en: Carmen is a member of the “Comuzone IV” communal bank and continues working in her dessert making business.  She’s been in this business for years and does well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She sells independently and to order for various social commitments like weddings and 15th birthday parties, among others.  She’s a responsible, dedicated person who supports her family this way.  She requests the loan to buy ingredients like flour, sugar and milk, among others.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar and milk, among others.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes ella vende productos de primera necesidas como arroz,azucar,leche entre otros,la socia a la vez es docente de un colegio particular del Cusco,la socia trabaja de lunes a viernes siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.


La socia solicita el credito para la compra de arroz y leche pàra su negocio. 

El Banco Comunal “Comuzone IV” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Luz Marina continues with her grocery store selling basic staples like rice, sugar and milk, among others.  She’s also a teacher at a private school in Cusco.  She works Monday to Friday and this is how she supports her family.  She requests the loan to buy rice and milk for the store.

The “Comuzone IV” communal bank meets monthly in the city of Cusco, Peru.  Cusco is noted for being a very touristy, commercial zone and for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and also because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located here.

loans.use: to buy rice and milk for her store.

loans.name: Chreb's Group

texts.en:
Chreb is aged 31 years, is married, and the mother of three children, all of whom are still in school. Her family lives in a rural village of the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer who grows rice on five hectares farmland and complements her income by selling grocery items. Having been in business for three years, she is able to earn about 40,000 KHR per day and save about 20,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. However, drought is the main challenge for her rice business. 

Chreb received the first loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, a cycle ago, while the other member is in her first cycle with VisionFund. Chreb completely repaid the past loan, which has helped her better support her family’s condition. Now her group is applying for a new loan of 1,200,000 KHR and 1,000,000 KHR respectively.  As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her rice paddy. She hopes this loan will help her to produce a high quality crop yield so as to improve her family’s lifestyle and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice paddy field

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Zorayda

texts.es: Zorayda, de 40 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora y dinámica, es soltera pero tiene 2 hijos de 17 y 9 años de edad respectivamente, vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos hijos y es por ellos por quienes se esfuerza todos los días para salir adelante y brindarles todo lo que se merecen. La actividad que realiza Zorayda es la venta de comida. Ha establecido un pequeño restaurante en su casa en donde ofrece los más variados platillos que caracterizan la cocina peruana, prepara los mas exquisitos guisos y otros potajes que se han convertido en los preferidos de sus clientes. La atención diaria empieza a las 7 de la mañana con la preparación de cortos pero muy nutridos desayunos como arroz con huevo y “chapo” (elaborado con plátano maduro, cocido y batido), y culmina cerca de las 3 de la tarde luego de haber vendido diferentes almuerzos. También ofrece bebidas como gaseosas, cervezas o jugos de distintos sabores. Lleva en este negocio más de 8 años y en ocasiones recibe el apoyo de su hija mayor y solo en casos excepcionales contrata otra persona para ayudarla en la preparación de los alimentos. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es la oportunidad que tiene de trabajar en lo que más le gusta, además de generar sus propios ingresos mediante su fuente de trabajo lo que le permite poder cubrir los gastos básicos de su hogar y las necesidades de sus hijos, afortunadamente le va bien y su clientela se mantiene muy fluida. Este es el préstamo número 6 con la institución MFP, por ello agradece a las personas que hacen posible su crédito y le dan la oportunidad de continuar trabajando para lograr sus objetivos, está comprometida al pago puntual de sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, comprará ingredientes e insumos que usa a diario en la preparación de sus platillos como arroz, condimentos, carnes, aceite y otros.
texts.en:
Zorayda is 40 years old. She is a hard-working, enterprising and energetic woman. She is single, but has two children, ages 17 and 9 respectively. She lives in her own home with her two children, and it is for their sake that she does her best every day to get ahead in life, and offer them everything they deserve. 

The work Zorayda does is selling food. She has established a small restaurant in her home, where she offers the most varied dishes that characterize  Peruvian cuisine. She prepares the most delicious chowders and stews that have become her customers' favorites. 

The daily service begins at 7 in the morning with the preparation of quick but very nutritious breakfasts such as rice with egg,  and “chapo” (made with ripe plantain, cooked and beaten), and ends around 3 in the afternoon, after she has sold various lunches. She also offers drinks such as soft drinks, beer, and juice of various flavors. 

She has had this business for more than eight years, and sometimes receives help from her eldest daughter, and only in exceptional cases hires another person to help her prepare the food. 

What she likes about her work is the chance she has to work doing what she likes best; besides generating her own income through her livelihood, which enables her to cover her basic household expenses and the needs of her children. Fortunately, it is going well, and her clientele is remaining very steady.  

This is her sixth loan with the MFP institution, so she is grateful to the people who make her loan possible and give her the chance to continue working to achieve her objectives. She is committed to making her installment payments on time and very responsibly. 

With the amount of 1000 nuevos soles applied for, she will buy ingredients and supplies that she uses daily in preparing her dishes, such as rice, condiments, meats, cooking oil and other products.

loans.use: To buy rice, condiments, meats, cooking oil, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Edwin Jesus

texts.es:
El socio es el señor Edwin, soltero con 39 años de edad, él se dedica a la fabricación de estructuras metálicas de todo tipo, el socio se dedica a este oficio hace algunos años, y es con esta que ha implementado e hizo crecer su taller de carpintería metallica.  Edwin está solicitando el préstamo para comprar material como electrodos para soldadura eléctrica.
