La socia pertenece al banco comunal SOLIDARIDAD - CCACHIMAYO,la socia continua con su negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia cria a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan ,la socia a la vez continua dedicandose al negocio de ganaderia de igual forma los cria para luego venderlos a sus clientes o en la ferias ,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de alimentos para sus animales como forraje,alfalfa y maiz.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
She is a member of the “SOLIDARIDAD – CCACHIMAYO” communal bank and continues with her business of raising small animals such as Guinea pigs and chickens.  She’s been doing this for years and puts in hard work each day.  She raises these animals to later resell them to her customers who request them and in fairs.  She is a responsible and hardworking woman and is the one who gets her family ahead.

She is asking for this loan to buy feed for her animals, such as hay, alfalfa, and corn.

She is grateful for the loan and promises to be on time with her payments.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals.

loans.name: Martha Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Martha, soltera con 36 años de edad y un hijo en la escuela, ella se dedica  a la atención de su restaurante, actividad que viene realizando hace algunos años y que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su hijo.
Martha está solicitando el préstamo para comprar insumos como carnes, verduras, menestras, arroz etc. para la producción de su restaurante. Martha está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, para fortalecer su actividad económica la cual le permite ofrecer una mejor educación a su hijo. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Martha is single and has a son who attends school.  She takes care of her restaurant and has been doing so for a few years.  It’s allowed her to get ahead with her son.

Martha is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies, such as meats, vegetables, vegetable stews, rice, etc. for her restaurant.  Martha is very grateful for Kiva’s help in strengthen her business, which allows her to provide a better education for her son.  She is a member of the “El Templo del Inca” communal bank, located in Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SOLIDARIDAD - CCACHIMAYO,la socia continua con su negocio  de salchipapas,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vendé de forma ambulatoria en una de las calles del distrito de Cachimayo,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como papa,aceite,salchichas y mostaza.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The loan recipient is a member of the village bank "Solidaridad - Cachimayo". She continues with her business selling salchipapas [sausage and french fries]. She has been doing it for awhile and it's going well thanks to the dedication she puts into it every day. She sells her product on one of the streets in the district of Cachimayo. She is responsible and dedicated and this is how she gets her family ahead. 

She asks for a loan to buy ingredients like potatoes, oil, sausages and mustard. She is grateful for the loan awarded to her and promises to meet her repayment quotas.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like potatoes, oil, sausages and mustard.

loans.name: Petra

texts.en: Petra is married and has two children. She has run her general store for five years. She is thankful to God because she is able to sustain their daily needs, send her eldest child to school and improve their way of living. She wants to have steady growth in her income so she can re-stock her general store. Her greatest dream is to offer her village a complete line of merchandise. To make her dream come true she applied for a loan of PHP 11,000 which she will use to buy more merchandise. In this way, she could generate more income which will enable her to sustain her family's basic needs, send her children into a higher level of education and have a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her variety store.

loans.name: Tarcela

texts.en:
Growing corn has been the primary source of income for Tarcela's family. But with her livestock business, she has been able to improve their standard of living gradually through the help of her loving husband. The couple were blessed with four children. Tarcela had engaged herself into raising hogs and corn crops. Ten years ago she started to raise hogs while four years ago she started her vegetable garden. According to Tarcela, her eldest child is married; another two are studying and the fourth is single and working at their municipality.

Tarcela wants to take out a loan of PHP 11,000. She will use this loan to buy hog feed, vitamins and also to buy vegetable seeds for her backyard garden. She hopes that she could get this loan amount to be able to increase her profits and educate her children. Tarcela is looking forward to continuous growth of her livestock and a productive vegetable garden.Then she could obtain greater income which will serve her family's needs and help develop the livestock business.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed, vitamins and also to buy seeds for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 49 years old and married with six children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Josephine has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport and raising pigs.

Josephine aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married and has three children. He is the only provider for the family.

Ibrahim owns a small coffee shop. He established his business in 2009, and he specializes in tea as well as coffee. He now has one employee and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $3000 loan to pay the annual rent for the shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his coffee shop

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Agnes will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will continue to educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing, which will increase her income and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de restaurant,la socia prepara desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,la socia preapara platos como arroz con pollo,saltado de carne y sopas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia tiene 6 años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es tener un local mas amplio para su restaurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz,verduras,pollo y carne.

La socia se compromete a hacer sus pagos en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The loan recipient continues with her business, a restaurant where she prepares breakfasts, lunches and dinners. She makes dishes like arroz con pollo [chicken and rice], beef stir fry and soups. She works from 8:00am to 6:00pm. She has been in this business for 6 years and her dream is to have a bigger space for her restaurant.

She asks for a loan to buy food products like rice, vegetables, chicken and beef. She promises to make her payments in the established time period.

loans.use: to buy food products like rice, vegetables, chicken and beef.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SOLIDARIDAD - CCACHIMAYO,la socia continua con su negocio de venta de ropa interior y venta de zapatos, la socia lleva años en  este negocio el cual le va bien gracias el empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cada cierto tiempo le manda dinero a su hermana para que compre la mercadería  para de esta forma la socia pueda vender su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de zapatos para su negocio.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The loan recipient is a member of the cooperative bank Solidaridad-Cachimayo. She continues with her business selling underclothes and shoes. She has been in this business for years and it's going well thanks to the dedication she puts into it every day. Every so often the recipient sends money to her sister to buy merchandise - this way she is able to sell the merchandise to her customers who ask for it. She is responsible and dedicated, and this business is how she gets her family ahead.

She asks for a loan to buy shoes for her business. She is grateful for the loan awarded to her and promises to meet her established payments.

loans.use: to buy shoes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. Erlinda is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Erlinda requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional netting and other materials for her fishing business.

Erlinda has been in this business for 11 years now.

In the future, Erlinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional netting and other materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Soeurt's Group

texts.en:
Soeurt lives in a rural village of the Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province, Cambodia. She is 60 years old and married with three children. She has earned a living through rice cropping on a three-hectare area of farmland for 35 years. She is able to earn about 28,000 KHR per day and save around 8,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. Low crop yield is the main challenge. 

Soeurt has been with Kiva’s partner VisionFund for three cycles and successfully paid back the past loans. She has wisely and successfully used the past loans to better support her family with sufficient food. Now she is leading her group of three to request a loan. Soeurt is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes her crop yield will become more productive and profitable so as to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
Marleni tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Ella antes solo se dedicaba a realizar los oficios domésticos en su casa, luego estuvo elaborando panes con pollo para vender durante dos años. Posteriormente, inicio un trabajo como fotógrafa y toma de videos. Hoy en día ella esta iniciando el negocio de la crianza y venta de pollos de engorde, ya que viene la temporada navideña y es cuando hay más demanda. El año pasado hizo una prueba con 60 pollos y obtuvo una buena ganancia, ya que ella lo administra en su propia casa, al mismo tiempo que se ocupa de cuidar a sus hijos, un varón de 13 años y una niña de 8 años de edad. Para comprar los pollos y el concentrado, viajan a la ciudad en el vehiculo que posee su esposo y tarda unos cuarenta y cinco minutos en llegar. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar 5 cuartones de madera, 15 láminas, un rollo de tela ciclón, bloque, plástico negro, pago de instalación de energía eléctrica, 300 pollos, 5 sacos de concentrado, comederos y bebederos de agua. Con esta inversión Marleni comprara los materiales para ampliar la galera en donde tiene sus pollos e incrementara la cantidad de pollos. A fin de recibir buenas ganancias que le permitan reparar el vehiculo de su esposo que esta en muy malas condiciones y es el que les sirve para realizar los viajes. A demás le servirá para proporcionar a su familia todo lo necesario para mejorar su calidad de vida. Su gran deseo, es brindarle la oportunidad a sus hijos de que estudien, debido a que por provenir de una familia de escasos recurso económicos no pudo estudiar y ella desea que sus hijos si lo hagan.
texts.en: Marleni is 34 years old, married and has two children. She used to be only dedicated to her household duties, but then started baking bread with chicken two years ago. Later, she started working as a photographer and taking videos. Today she is starting a business raising and selling chickens, since Christmastime is coming and that is when there is the most demand. Last year she gave it a try with 60 chickens and made a good profit, and she ran the business from her own home while caring for her two children, a 13-year-old boy and a 8-year-old girl. She travels to the city to buy the chickens and the feed in her husband's car, and it takes about 45 minutes. She is requesting the loan to purchase five pallets of wood, 15 zinc sheets, a roll of fabric, cinder blocks, black plastic sheeting, 300 chickens, five bags of feed, and feeding and drinking bins, and to pay for electrical installation. With this investment, Marleni will be able to upgrade her chicken coop and increase the number of chickens it holds. After taking her profits she will be able to repair her husband's car, which is in poor condition. It will also help her provide her family with everything it needs to improve its quality of life. Her biggest wish is for her children to have the opportunity to get an education, because she came from a family with limited resources and could not afford to go to school, and she wants her children to have what she couldn't.

loans.use: to purchase wood, zinc sheets, fabric, cinder blocks, black plastic sheeting, 300 chicks, five sacks of feed, and feeding and drinking bins, and to pay for electrical installation.

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en:
Cresilda is 48 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Cresilda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy items for her general store. She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, canned goods and soft drinks. In the future, Cresilda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items for her general store

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
Verginia of Gapasan, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, has been raising pigs for more than three years and earns 3,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month. She’s 51 years old now, yet continues to hang on with her piggery livelihood to make an adequate life for her child. 

She's been a member of GDMPC since 2009. In order to enhance her livestock upon selling, she borrowed the amount of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to purchase feeding supplies. Verginia hopes that someday, her child will be successful in a career.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 13,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy an additional pump boat for her fishing business.

Florenda has been in this business for three years. Florenda earns more income from a general store.

Florenda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional pump boat for her fishing business.

loans.name: Ladfy Esther

texts.es:
La socia es la señorita Ladfy, soltera con 19 años de edad, ella se dedica  a la venta de calzado por catalogo, actividad que viene realizando para poder ahorrar y continuar con sus estudios superiores.
Ladfy está solicitando el préstamo para comprar mercadería y estoquearse para la próxima campaña navideña. Ladfy está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, por ayudarla a fortalecer su actividad económica la cual le permitirá acceder a una mejor educación. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en: Our member, Ladfy, is a single 19 year old.  She makes a living selling footwear from a catalog so that she can continue saving and paying for her studies.  Ladfy is seeking a loan to purchase merchandise to stock her business for the coming Christmas season.  She is very grateful to Kiva for helping her strengthen her business which allows her to access a good education.  Ladfy is a member of the communal bank "El Templo del Inca" in Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to purchase footwear.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is 40 years old and a divorced man. He lives with his five children and takes care of them. Mohamed has a motorcycle taxi in which he makes journeys to different parts of town. He says that his job is too risky because he is at times forced to pass through dark alleys at night. There have been cases of insecurity over the past months. Despite these challenges, he is not faint of heart. 

He is requesting a loan as he really wishes to have maintenance work done on his motorcycle taxi. He hopes that he will thereby be able to provide a safer service and have more work to support his household.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle and buy spare parts.

loans.name: Nimol's Group

texts.en:
Nimol is 24 years old and a citizen in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has one daughter who is dependent on her and too young for schooling. To tackle the financial difficulty, Nimol and her husband have done rice-cropping on six hectares of farmland for several years as the main source of their famiily's income. To increase their income, this couple also runs a small grocery store at home. Both businesses have provided her about 20,000 KHR per day. She has saved about 14,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. However, a lack of water supply is still the main challenge for her paddy business.

Nimol’s group consists of five members who live in the same village. She and two of her fellow group members are in their second-cycle microloan, while the remaining two members are first-time borrowers with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Nimol feels empowered that she can relieve her family's burden and improve their livelihood after the past loans were paid back with success. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. Nimol, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and split a portion of it to buy more grocery items for reselling. She hopes her crop yield will become more productive and profitable so as to make a better living for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is married and has three children. Virginia is 47 years old and resides at Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay. Virginia owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living, and she's been 25 years in this business. Each month, she earns 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2010, Virginia joined GDMPC. In the future, Virginia wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales y ganados,la socia cria cuyes,gallinas y chanchos,la socia los hace crecer y engordra y luego los vende en los diferentes mercados y tambien saca leche de los ganados y los vende,la socia se dedica a estos negocios 6 años y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar alimentos para los animales y tambien para comprar pollos,cuyes y chanchos.

La socia está agradecida por el apoyo que se otorgará a ella y también se ha comprometido a ser disciplinados en hacer los pagos.
texts.en: Luz Marina continues to work on her business of raising animals and cattle.  She raises guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs.  She makes them grow large and then sells them at different markets.  She also sells the milk of her cattle.  She has been doing this for the last six years and it is going very well for her.  Her dream is to have her own store where she can sell the animals.  She is seeking a loan to purchase animal feed as well as guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs.  She is grateful for the support and promises to be disciplined in her payments.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed and chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
This is Mary Grace. She previously accessed an 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase additional stock of supplies and materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy additional stock of supplies, materials and medicines needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store, the better sales and profits will be. Her profits from business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Mary Grace dreams of expanding her business in the coming years and hopes to give her family a good future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* where she shares stories of her work with other members every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of supplies, materials and medicines needed in her business

loans.name: Savy's Group

texts.en:
Savy, 34, lives in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has four children, three of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She is a rice farmer and grows rice on two hectares of farmland. Having been in this business for several years, she is able to earn about 15,000 KHR per day and save about 7,000 KHR of that after deducting daily expenses. Low crop yield is the main challenge for her paddy field.

Savy has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle. She fully repaid the first loan, which has helped her support her family’s living condition. Now, she and her group member are asking for a loan of 500,000 KHR and 100,000 KHR, respectively. As the leader, Savy will use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will help her to increase her income to make a good quality of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Nikolin

texts.en:
Nikolin is a 44-year-old man who was remarried after his first wife passed away suddenly, leaving him with three very young children. Now he is expecting another child soon. 

Being the only one to bring an income home, it has been very difficult for him, Nikolin claims. “Not only I had to care for my family financially all those years, but lately emotionally too. My kids have been grieving ever since and at times I don’t know what else to do for them to fade away their pain. I find myself lost as well,” he continued saying, wiping away his tears.

When the children’s mother passed away, Nikolin started his livestock business in order to look after them instead of doing a traditional job as he had done up to that time. Since the business has been doing well, and he has been happy with the income, Nikolin now wants to repair the stable. This is why he is requesting a loan this time.

Nikolin remains positive and hopes he will be supported by lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing stable.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is 32 years old. He is married to a business woman. They have two children between the ages of 5 months and 5 years. He owns a bar where he sells different items such as beer and soda. He wants the loan to add more beers and sodas to the stock for sale. The profits from the business will be used for savings.

loans.use: To buy more beers and sodas for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Chhoen's Group

texts.en:
Chhoen is a resident of a rural village in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is 49 years old and married with one son. She has earned a living through farming rice on four-hectares of farmland for 33 years. She is able to earn about 20,000 KHR per day and save around 10,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. The shortage of water for her paddy is the main challenge.

Chhoen has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two cycles and successfully paid back her loans. The other members have been with VisionFund for one or two cycles. She has wisely used the past loans to better support her family with sufficient food. Now, she is leading her group of three to request a loan. Chhoen is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes her crop yield will become more profitable and productive in order to improve her family's rural living conditions..

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is an electrician from the Mukuru informal settlement of Nairobi. Along with his wife and three children, he runs a small shop in the community. Anthony also has land north of the city on which he runs a potato farm. 

Anthony is interested in running a Fresh Life toilet business because he has heard other Fresh Life operators sing its praises. He often sees businesses start and subsequently flounder very rapidly, but believes that with the ongoing business support and insurance from Fresh Life, this venture will not fail. Anthony’s ultimate goal with this business is to make enough profits to further his education at the university level.

loans.use: To purchase and run Fresh Life toilets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets.

loans.name: Sinoun's Group

texts.en:
Sinoun is a 57-year-old married mother of three children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. She lives in a village in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district of Cambodia. To support the family, she has been engaged in farming rice on 2.5 hectares of farmland for 28 years while her husband works as a solider. Sinoun earns approximately 18,000 KHR per day and saves about 10,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. Drought is the main challenge for her paddy-field business. 

She has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for four loan cycles and the other member has been with VisionFund for three cycles. She completely repaid the past loans, which have enabled her to relieve her family’s burden and improve their livelihood. Now, she is leading her group to request a loan. Sinoun, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy rice seeds, fertilizer and pesticide for her farm and to pay for labor fees. She hopes this loan will enable her crop yield to become more profitable in order to make a better living and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
This is Marciana. She previously accessed a 9,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to provide her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marciana hopes her business grows and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the study of the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials like fabric and thread

loans.name: Sayoeng

texts.en:
Sayoeng is aged 45 years and married with four children, three of whom are dependent on her and help the family’s business. She lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has been growing rice on 3 hectares of farmland and corn on 2 hectares of farmland as the main source of the family’s income. She has been in this business for 12 years to support the family. She is able to earn about 30,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 20,000 KHR each day after offsetting expenses for future needs. Lack of water supply for supporting the rice paddy is the main challenge.

This is the second microloan for Sayoeng with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She successfully paid back the past loan which has supported her family's living conditions. Now she is requesting a loan with VisionFund of 4,000,000 KHR. With this loan, she is going to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income from the rice paddy so as to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en: Antoinette is 39 years old. She is married to a businessman and they have three children. She sells goats and has spent 17 years in similar businesses. The profits from the business will be saved for the future of her business.

loans.use: To buy more goats to sell

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: La socia es la señora Marcelina, madre de 3 hijos, ella continúa con su actividad económica de elaboración y comercialización de queso, pero adicionalmente la socia esta incursionando en el oficio de corte y confección, elaborando prendas de vestir  en general y disfraces. Marcelina en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para capitalizar su actividad alternativa de costura y comprar telas, hilos y accesorios para la confección de sus disfraces. Marcelina está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, por ayudarla a fortalecer su actividad económica la cual le permite ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Marcelina, who has three children, continues in her business of making and selling cheese, but the member has also branched out to become a seamstress, making general clothing and costumes.  On this occasion, Marcelina is requesting a loan for her sewing business, to buy fabric, thread and sewing accessories to make costumes.

Marcelina is very grateful for the KIVA help, since it has strengthened her business activity, allowing her to give her family a better quality of life.  She belongs to the communal bank "KANCHARY" in Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread and accessories to make costumes.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: La socia es la señora Rosario, ella continúa con su actividad económica de comercialización de artesanías, principalmente elementos de joyería como collares, pulseras, aretes etc.. Rosario en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para capitalizar su actividad y comprar las joyas y accesorios en plata que mas demanda tiene. Rosario está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, por ayudarla a fortalecer su actividad económica la cual le permite ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
The member, Rosario, continues with her craft business, mainly jewelry items such as necklaces, bracelets, earrings, etc.  On this occasion, Rosario is requesting a loan for business capital to buy silver jewelry and accessories that are in highest demand.

Rosario is very grateful for the KIVA help, which has strengthened her business, allowing her to give her family a better quality of life.  The member belongs to the communal bank "KANCHARY" in Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: To buy silver jewelry and accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Concepción, 57 años de edad, soltera y con 4 hijos, 2 de ellos dependientes de ella, Concepción  se dedica  al negocio del restaurante, y es con esta actividad que sacó adelante a todos sus hijos.
Concepción está solicitando el préstamo para invertirlo en capitalizar su restaurante  y comprar insumos como arroz, fideos, verduras, carnes y granos para la producción de su restaurante. Concepción está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, para fortalecer su actividad económica la cual le permite ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
This member, Concepción, is 57, single and has four children, two of which are independent.  Concepción has a restaurant business which has allowed her to support her children.

Concepción is requesting a loan to capitalize her restaurant and buy supplies such as rice, noodles, vegetables, meat and grains to make meals.  She is very grateful for the KIVA help which has strengthened her business, allowing her to give her family a better quality of life.  The member belongs to the communal bank "KANCHARY" in Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as rice, noodles, vegetables, meat and grains.

loans.name: Yehia

texts.en:
Yehia is a 45-year-old married man and father of five children. He has been preparing and selling sweets for 18 years. He is well known in the region with his special taste Arabic sweets and delights. Yehia is working hard on improving his business as much as he can. That's why he moved to a wider factory and shop four months ago, which attracted more customers and increased his sales.

To keep on expanding his business, Yehia is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, which he will use to buy a special Petit Four mixer that will help him start manufacturing foreign sweets. Yehia is working hard at diversifying his products to keep his customers satisfied.

This is Yehia's ninth cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower with an excellent history in paying back his loans.  He says that all of his previous loans were invested in expanding his business by increasing his machinery, tools and raw materials, which led to improving both his social and financial situation, in addition to his image in the region.

loans.use: To buy a special sweets mixer

loans.name: Cheat

texts.en:
Cheat is a citizen from a rural village in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district of Cambodia. She is 40 years old and married with four children, three of whom are dependent on her and too young for school. To make a living, she has been growing rice on eight hectares of farmland for 20 years and supplementing her family’s income by growing pineapples to support the family. She is able to earn about 30,000 KHR per day and save about 20,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. Insufficient water supply for her paddy is still the main challenge.

This is the first micro loan for Cheat with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR. She is going to use this loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase more income from her crop yield to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Garik

texts.en:
Garik is a young farmer from Yeghegnadzor town in the Vayots Dzor region. Garik breeds cows, pigs, hens, and rabbits and grows fruit trees. Currently, Garik keeps the livestock in an old barn, which does not allow him to create the necessary conditions for the livestock, especially during the cold winter season. So, Garik wants to construct a new barn, for which he needs sufficient funds. With the help of this loan, he plans to purchase construction materials for the barn. Garik also plans to purchase grass to feed the cows and sawdust to feed the hens. 

Garik lives with his wife, two-year-old daughter, brother and parents. Stable development of agriculture is important for him to earn enough income and sustain the family.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and construction materials for the barn

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: Madame Coumba est une femme divorcée qui vit dans une des localités sénégalaises. Elle capitalise une expérience de plus de 2 ans dans le secteur du commerce et pratique l’activité de restauratrice. Les revenus que lui procure son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge les frais de scolarité de ses enfants, de meme les factures d’électricité, le salaire de la domestique et une participation à la dépense quotidienne. Elle consacre 12 heures de temps de la journée à son activité. Elle est membre dans l’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC et sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs. Une partie du crédit est  prévu pour la réfection de sa gargote  et l’autre partie sera destinée à l’achat de matériels et d’ustensiles qu’elle utilise dans l’exercice de son activité. Son objectif  est d’améliorer le cadre de son local pour mieux attirer la clientèle de meme que la qualité  des repas qu’elle offre a sa clientèle. L’augmentation de ses bénéfices lui permettra de mieux supporter ses charges familiales, de d’épargner de l’argent et d’améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille.
texts.en:
Coumba is a divorced woman who lives in a Senegalese village. She has over 2 years experience in the retail sector as a restaurateur. The income generated by her business enables her to take care of her children's education expenses, pay the electricity bills and the salary of the domestic worker, and contribute to the daily expenses. She spends 12 hours a day at work.

Coumba is a member of a UIMCEC branch and is requesting a loan of 200 000 francs, part of which will be used to repair her small restaurant and part of which will go towards buying the kitchen equipment and utensils that she uses for her business. Her aim is to improve the setting of her business in order to draw in more customers, and to improve the quality of the meals that she offers to her clientèle. An increase in her profits would enable her to better manage her family expenses, build up her savings and improve her family's food conditions.

loans.use: to repair her small restaurant and buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.fr: Madame Fatima est une femme mariée. Elle habite dans une des localités sénégalaises. Elle s’active depuis plus de 5 ans dans le secteur de la couture. Elle confectionne et vend des habits prêts a porter. Elle consacre 11 heures de temps de la journée à son activité. Les profits qui lui sont générés lui permettent de payer le loyer et ses employeurs, mais aussi de supporter la dépense quotidienne de sa famille. Elle est sociétaire dans l’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC et sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’une machine a coudre plus performante  en vue de mieux rentabiliser son activité. Son ambition est d’augmenter dans l’avenir le nombre de ses machines ainsi que le nombre de ses employés.
texts.en:
Fatima is a married woman. She lives in a Senegalese village. She has been working in the sewing sector for over 5 years. She makes and sells ready-to-wear clothing. She spends 11 hours a day at work. The profits generated by her business allow her to pay the rent and her employees, and also to take care of her family's daily expenses.

Fatima is a member of a UIMCEC branch and is requesting a loan of 500 000 francs which will be used to buy a more high-performance sewing machine in order to make her business more profitable. Her aim is to eventually increase the number of machines she owns and people she employs.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Avec ce premier prêt que madame Akouvi sollicite auprès de WAGES, elle va s’acheter de la farine de blé, des bidon d’huile et des sacs de sucre. Ces matières premières dont elle a besoin, lui servira à préparer des beignets. Activité qu’elle mène depuis 2002 à domicile, madame Akouvi âgée de 37ans, mère de 02 enfants (12 et 05ans) tous scolarisés a pour mari un enseignant. Avec les bénéfices de son activité, elle assurer l’autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille et le renforcement de l’activité.
texts.en: Akouvi is requesting her first loan from WAGES in order to buy wheat flour, cans of oil and bags of sugar. These are the primary ingredients that she needs to make doughnuts. Akouvi has been running her home-based business since 2002. She is 37 years old, married to a teacher and the mother of 2 children, aged 5 and 12, who both go to school. She will use the profits from her business to ensure that her family is self-sufficient in food and to strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, cans of oil and bags of sugar.

loans.name: Affi

texts.fr: Mariée à un comptable et mère d’01 enfant de 06ans qui va à l’école, madame Affi âgée de 31ans est revendeuse de profession. Elle vend des bazins et autres tissus depuis 2008 à domicile et de façon ambulante à ses clients. Les demandes deviennent de plus en plus importantes et n’arrivant pas à satisfaire ses clients, elle sollicite de WAGES un second prêt pour acheter des pagnes et d’autres tissus pour dames afin de garder sa clientèle. Elle veut développer son activité par l’ouverture d’une boutique et assurer au coté de son mari les charges du foyer.
texts.en: Married to an accountant and mother to a 6-year-old child who attends school, Affi is 31 years old and a retailer. She has been selling damask and other fabrics to her customers since 2008, both at home and on the street. The demand is increasing more and more and, as she is not able to satisfy her customers, she is requesting a second loan from WAGES in order to buy pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African cloth) and other fabrics for women's clothing, so that she can keep her clientèle. She would like to expand her business by opening a shop and to take care of the household expenses, together with her husband.

loans.use: to buy damask and other fabrics.

loans.name: Komi Isaac

texts.fr: Komi Isaac est un jeune homme de 38ans. Il est marié et papa de 02 enfants. Il est revendeur de profession. Sa boutique qu’il a ouvert dans un quartier  de la place lui permet de revendre des vêtements qu’il s’approvisionne chez les grossistes  venant de la CHINE. Il est à son premier prêt à WAGES et il lui servira à acheter des habits pour revendre aux clients. Comme perspectives d’avenir, il voudrait renforcer son activité et assurer l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en: Komi Isaac is a young, 38-year-old man. He is married and father to 2 children. He is a retailer. His shop, which he opened in a local district, enables him to sells clothing which he buys from Chinese wholesalers. This is his first loan from WAGES and it will be used to buy clothing for resale to his customers. His long term plans are to strengthen his business and to ensure that his family flourishes.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr: Monsieur Babacar est un couturier marié qui évolue dans le secteur depuis plus de 10 ans. Il  s’active dans  la confection et la vente de prêts à porter. Il consacre 11 heures de temps à son activité. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus et garnitures destinés  a confectionner des habits a revendre a l’occasion de la fête de Tabaski. L’accroissement de ses revenus lui permettra de mieux supporter ses charges (loyer, électricité, salaires personnel, dépense quotidienne), d’épargner et d’améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Babacar souhaite agrandir son atelier dans le futur pour  mieux développer son activité.
texts.en: Babacar is a married tailor who has been in his line of work for over 10 years. He makes and sells ready-to-wear clothing. He spends 11 hours a day working. He is a member of a UIMCEC branch and is requesting a loan of 500 000 francs so that he can buy fabrics and trimmings with which to make clothing to sell for the Tabaski festival. An increase in his income would allow him to better cover his expenses (rent, electricity, salaries, daily expenses), to build savings and to improve his family's food conditions. Babacar would eventually like to expand his workshop in order to better develop his business.

loans.use: to buy fabric with which to make clothing for resale.

loans.name: Mazide Ismail

texts.en:
Mazide  is a 40-year-old  businessman who lives in Juba.  He is married, with 4 children between the ages of 3 and 12.  All of them are in school.

Mazide runs a general store, has been in business for 3 years, and has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers.

He is taking a loan of 2000sdg to purchase groundnuts, and many other items.  He has no source of income other than this business.

In 5 years, Mazide would like to expand his business and open other branches.  His major challenges include high market prices.

Mazide says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of  Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like groundnuts.

loans.name: Lamie

texts.en:
Lamie is 32 years old and single. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Lamie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, plastic bags, and spices. 

In the future, Lamie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bakery business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more ingredients for her bakery. Patricia has been in this business for 15 years. She earns additional income from raising pigs and farming rice. Patricia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her bakery

loans.name: Dada Alfred

texts.en:
Dada is a 35-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has 3 children between the ages of 3 and 9. All of them go to school.
Dada runs a general store, and has been in business for 4 years. He doesn't have any employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by loan officers. He is taking a loan of 3000 SDG to purchase dry fish, sugar, oil, and many other items. This business is Dada's only source of income.

In 5 years Dada would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenge is the high cost of transportation.

Dada says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: buy more sugar, dry fish, oil, etc.

loans.name: Chhoen's Group

texts.en:
Originally in a village of the Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Chhoen is a 55-year-old mother of nine children. One of her children is dependent on her and helps the family’s business. Chhoen has farmed rice on 1.5 hectares of farmland for 20 years to make a living. She is able to earn about KHR 30,000 per day and save about KHR 10,000 each day for her future needs. Insufficient water supply and fertilizer for supporting her paddy field are still the main challenges for her business.

Chhoen’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for one cycle. Chhoen fully repaid the past loan, which helped her relieve her family’s burden and improve their livelihood. Now, she and her group member are requesting a loan of KHR 600,000 and KHR 1,000,000, respectively. As the leader, Chhoen will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to pay for labor fees in plowing the field. She hopes this loan will help her grow healthy and fruitful rice so as to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Rahamatou

texts.fr: Jeune dame de 28ans, Rahamatou est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants en charge. Elle est revendeuse des produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2005 dans un marché de la place. Avec son troisième crédit qu’elle sollicite à WAGES, elle va acheter des produits d’alimentation générale, revendre,tirer des profits pour pouvoir assurer son bien être et se marier plus tard.
texts.en:
A young 28-year-old woman, Rahamatou is single and does not have any children under her care. 

She has been selling general food products in a local market since 2005. 

With her third loan from WAGES, she is going to buy general food products, resell them, and make profits in order to ensure her well-being and to get married later.

loans.use: to buy general food products

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr: Joséphine a 43ans et son conjoint est retraité. Pour pouvoir joindre les deux bouts, elle vend il y a 01an des produits céréaliers et des tubercules dans un marché de la place. Son approvisionnement se fait soit à Lomé ou dans les villes environnantes du pays. Pour augmenter son stock de marchandises, elle sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit pour s’acheter des produits céréaliers et des tubercules. Avec les profits qu’elle réalisera, elle va augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et assurer le bien être de la famille.
texts.en:
Joséphine is 43 years old and her husband is retired. To make ends meet, she has been selling grains and tubers in a local market for the past year. She gets her supplies in Lomé or in neighboring towns of the country. 

To increase her stock, she is asking WAGES for a first loan to buy grains and tubers. With the profits that she will make, she is going to increase her income and ensure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy grains and tubers

loans.name: Bellavista  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Bellavista está conformado por 7 socias y 1 socio quienes son vecinos y amigos, viven por una comunidad que  pertenece a la parroquia  Victoria del Portete en Cuenca, lugar de extensas llanuras y hermosos paisajes, su clima es frió. Su gente trabaja en la ganadería, cría de animales pequeños, agricultura y muchos trabajan en la ciudad en diferentes actividades, se caracterizan también por ser personas que aun mantienen viva la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Ligia, tiene 24 años, es casada y ha concebido 2 hijos  de 4 y 2 años de edad. Su esposo labora prestando sus servicios en una compañía privada, la casa en la que viven no es propia.

La Señora. Ligia pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo al cuidado de sus hijos que son pequeños, como tiene terreno se dedica a la crianza de ganado desde hace 4 años, trabaja cuidando su ganado de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo, la leche que obtiene la vende en su comunidad.
 
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ganado para continuar creciendo en la cría de estos animales.
 
Su meta es tener un trabajo en una entidad financiera, para así tener dos ingresos para ayudar un poco más en la economía de su hogar.,
texts.en:
The Bellavista community bank is made up of seven women and one man who are friends and neighbors.  They live in a community in Victoria del Portete parish, in Cuenca.  This area has vast plains and beautiful landscapes.  It has a cold climate.  The local people work in cattle farming, livestock raising and agriculture.  Many work in the city in different jobs.  They are noted for keeping alive the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

One of the members of this group is Ligia.  Ligia is 24 years old, married, and has two children who are 4 and 2 years old.  Her husband works for a private company.  They do not own the house in which they live.

Ligia spends most of her time caring for her children who are still young.  As she has land available, she has been raising cattle for four years.  She take cares of her cows from Sunday to Sunday.  She does not work fixed hours and sells the milk in her community.

Ligia will invest her loan in buying more cattle so that she can continue expanding her business.

Ligia's goal is to get a job working for a financial company so that she will have two incomes and be able to help a little more in improving her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Shefqet

texts.en:
Shefqet is in his early sixties and lives in a rural village in central Albania. He lives with a married son and his children. A couple of years back, his wife passed away. Since then, he has been looking after his grandniece, who he very much adores. He is also shifting his focus to animal husbandry and agriculture. His progress in this activity looks good, and he makes a good income from it, should he work hard.

Shefqet wants to buy fodder for his animals, and this is the reason he is applying for a loan through VisionFund Albania.

His dream is to add some more goats and sheep in the near future and make and save enough money to educate his grandniece (the one he has been photographed with for this profile).

loans.use: To stock up on winter fodder for his animals

loans.name: Villa De Oro  (Montecristi) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Villa De Oro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Este es un grupo de 12 mujeres y 2 hombres que decidieron unirse y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les ha servido  de mucho ya que con los créditos ellos han podido mejorar sus pequeños negocios. Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades tales como agricultura, comercio en general, servicios, entre otras actividades.

Uno de los socios de este grupo es el señor Hermes, tiene 47 años de edad, está separado pero de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y uno de 9 años que estudia en escuela y vive con la mamá a pesar de que es él que se hace cargo de los gastos de su hijo.

Don Hermes se dedica al comercio, es proveedor al por mayor de pescado, él viaja hasta otras ciudades costeras a comprar el mejor pescado para luego trasladarlo a la ciudad de Manta lugar en el cual entrega a varias empresas que procesan el pescado, lleva 29 años dedicada a esta actividad la cual le ha dado muy buenos beneficios. 

Este crédito es para comprar pescado, este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la rapidez con que salen los créditos. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y su vida personal.

Las dos fotos pequeñas son de un socio y una socia que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Villa De Oro community bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi canton.  This area is noted for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts which are well known both at home and abroad.  It is home to the famous Panama hat.

This is a group of 12 women and 2 men who decided to come together and form a loan group.  The group has been very useful to them as they have been able to improve their small businesses through their loans.  The members work in different areas such as farming, general commerce, services, etc.

One of the members of this group is 47-year-old Hermes.  Hermes is separated but has three children from his relationship.  Two of his children are adults whilst the youngest is 9 years old and attending school.  He lives with his mom in spite of the fact that Hermes is the one who provides for him financially.

Hermes works in commerce.  He is a wholesale supplier of fish.  He travels to other coastal towns to buy the best fish available.  He then transports it to the city of Manta where he delivers it to a number of companies who process fish.  He has been in this business for 29 years and it has made him very good profits.

Hermes will use this loan to buy fish.  This is his first loan cycle as a member of his community bank and he likes it for the speed with which loans are disbursed.

Hermes' goals are to continue making progress in his business and also in his personal life.

The two small photos are of group members who could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 64 years old and married with five children.

Lolita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional products to sell in her general store.

Lolita has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 40 years and also earns an income from raising livestock and gasoline.

Lolita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Las Profesoras Group

texts.es:
Grupo formada por tres socias emprendedoras que se dedican a brindar servicios de sala de belleza, corte de pelo, permanentes, tinte.
Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 18 años, además de su actividad como microempresaria es trabajadora como directora de un centro educativo.

El crédito lo utilizara para compra de tintes, permanentes, queratina, pinturas de uñas, cosméticos etc.
Doña Janeth su negocio es de bisutería y una pequeña pulpería, además es profesora de un centro educativo. Doña Thelma  su negocio es de bisutería y una pequeña pulpería además trabaja como docente en un centro educativo.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three entrepreneurial women.  Julieta provides beauty salon services:hair cutting, perms and dyes. She has been in this business for 18 years.  In addition to her work as a micro businesswoman, she also works as a school principal.  She will use her loan to buy dyes, perm materials, keratin treatments, nail polish, cosmetics, etc.

Janeth's business is selling costume jewelry.  In addition, she has a grocery store and works as a teacher.  Thelma's business is selling costume jewelry.  She also has a small grocery store and works as a school teacher.

loans.use: to buy keratin treatments, nail polish, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig raising business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pig raising business.

Luzminda has been in this business for 11 years. Luzminda earns more income from her general store.

Luzminda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Malo

texts.en:
Malo is 29 years old and married with one child.

Malo works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of soft drinks to sell.

Malo has been in this business for nine years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Malo aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Tawakalatou

texts.fr: Agée de 38ans, Tawakalatou est mère de 04 enfants tous sur les bancs de l’école. Ils sont âgés de 13, 11,08 et 06ans. Son conjoint est revendeur et madame tawakalatou exerce aussi le commerce. Elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale dans une boutique et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Ce prêt qu’elle sollicite à WAGES lui servira à s’approvisionner en produits d’alimentation générale. Elle voudrait assurer le bien être de la famille et rendre pérenne son activité.
texts.en:
Tawakalatou is 38 years old and mother of four children, all of whom go to school. Her children are 6, 8, 11, and 13 years old. Her husband is a retailer, and she too works in commerce.

She sells general foodstuffs in a shop and stocks up in Lomé.

The loan that she is seeking from WAGES will allow her to stock up in general foodstuffs. She would like to ensure her family's well-being and the long-term viability of her business.

loans.use: to buy general foodstuffs

loans.name: Virgen

texts.es:
EL  Banco Comunal Los Tamarindos se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad del Valle, ciudad de clima cálido de hermosas mujeres y con una gran variedad en su gastronomía.

La señora Virgen tiene 52 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos, cuatro mayores de edad y dos de 17 y 15 años los mismos que estudian en colegio,  tres de sus hijos aun viven con ella.

Ella es una mujer muy luchadora que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y con su esfuerzo sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella tiene un restaurante en su casa, allí  prepara deliciosos desayunos y almuerzos, todos los días ella varia el menú con la finalidad de darles a sus clientes lo que ellos prefieren y es por esta razón por la cual cada dia llegan más personas a comer en su local, trabaja todos los días y sus hijos le ayudan en su negocio, lleva más de 15 años con su local el cual le da lo necesario para salir adelante.

Este crédito es para comprar  víveres para preparar los alimentos, esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le han brindado a través de los créditos.

Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The Tamarindos community bank meets once every two weeks in the beautiful city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí.  It is known as the Valley City.  It has a hot climate and is home to beautiful women.  The local cuisine is wide ranging.  

Virgen is 52 years old, separated, and has six children from her relationship.  Four of her children are adults.  The other two are 17 and 15 years old and attending school.  Three of her children still live with her.

Virgen is a very hard-working woman who has always enjoyed working.  Through her efforts she has managed to provide for her children.  She has a restaurant in her home where she prepares delicious breakfasts and lunches.  Every day she varies the menu so that she can provide her customers with what they most want.  For this reason, her number of customers increases every day.  Virgen works every day and her children help her in the business.  She has owned her restaurant for more than 15 years and her business provides her with what she needs to keep making progress.

Virgen will use this loan to buy supplies for preparing her food.  She has been a member of her community bank since the beginning and she likes it because of the help that she has always received through loans.

Virgen's dream is to make further progress in her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Ndejje Tusubira Group

texts.en:
John  has been in the group since 2003.

He joined the group when he was jobless and depended on riding other people's motorcycles to earn a living. With the help of loans John was able to buy his own motorcycle and is now building a house where he can reside with his family so that he saves on the high cost of renting in the city. 

John will use the money to finish his incomplete house and a portion of it to pay school fees for his children. His hard work and dedication have earned him the post of secretary in the group.

loans.use: To complete his house

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of 7 children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle transport business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business further.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her business

loans.name: Anathalie

texts.en: Anathalie is 54 years old. She is married and has seven children. She sells different items in her shop. With the loan, she wishes to add more items for sale such as cooking oil, soap, and sugar. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business. She is very proud of her business and the sky is the limit for her.

loans.use: To buy more items such as cooking oil, soap and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Donathile

texts.en: Donathile is 66 years old. She is a widow who has three children. She is requesting a loan to buy more sorghum to make local juice. She has been making this local juice for 32 years. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy sorghum for making more local juice for sale.

loans.name: Besart

texts.en:
Besart is 21 years old and is recently married. He lives in a village in Kosovo. As part of family tradition, Besart sells milk and cheese produced from goats. He sells approximately 20 liters per day at 1 euro per liter. He also sells the goat cheese at 5 euros per kg. He sells 25 kg a week in his area.  

This agricultural business has had much success and profit as he has been doing it for a long time, and it has been going very well due to the great effort that he puts into his business every day. 

In addition to the goat products, in order to generate more income, he also works in a car wash. He is asking for a loan to buy food for the upcoming winter season for his goat. This loan will ensure that he is able to sustain his goat during the rough season. His goal is to raise the number of goats that he has. 

Besart is very thankful to Kiva lenders for the support!

loans.use: To buy food for the upcoming winter season for his goat.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. Marilyn is married and has a manicure/pedicure business in the Philippines.

Marilyn requested a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy a manicure set and other new tools for her business.

Marilyn has been in this business for 27 years now, and also earns additional income from food vending.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a manicure set and other new tools for her business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Norma works hard to support her family.

Norma has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from an internet cafe. Norma  is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy fabrics for her tailoring business.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is aged 24. She is married with one child. She sells fruit and she is requesting the loan to buy more fruits such as tree tomatoes (tamarillos) and oranges for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in a similar business.

loans.use: To buy more fruit such as tree tomatoes (tamarillos) and oranges for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy textiles used in making school and office uniforms

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is a married woman with seven children. For the last 15 years, she has been selling goats at the market assisted by her children who are grown-ups. Besides this, she is a farmer selling her farm products at the market and at home. 

Dzame is asking a loan in the amount of Ksh 50,000 to invest it in her business. With this loan she will be able to buy more goats to sell. She wants to take advantage of this festive season where most people consume meat. Dzame says that it has been a profitable business and thus she has not regretted since she started it.

loans.use: to buy more goats to sell.

loans.name: Generose

texts.en: Generose is 55 years old. She sells sorghum and has been selling that for the period of five years. With the loan, she wants to add more beans and sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to put aside savings.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum and beans for sale.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 40 years old and married. She has three children.

Gina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a junk shop in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional scrap to sell.

Gina has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the junk shop for 16 years and also earns an income from manufacturing candles.

Gina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional scrap to sell.

loans.name: Pophie

texts.en:
Pophie is 29 years old. She is married and has two children. She sells goat hides and cow hides. She has spent four years in the business. 

With the loan, she wants to add more hides for sale because the shoe and bag making industries need them so much. She plans to use the profits from the business to buy a small truck, which will help her with transportation for those hides.

loans.use: To buy more hides for making clothes for sale.

loans.name: José Lougures

texts.es:
Don José tiene 40 años de edad, es casado y tiene 7 hijos. Él se dedica a la elaboración de pan desde que tenía 9 años de edad, fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron. Para comprar los materiales que necesita, se traslada a la ciudad en su vehiculo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para reconstruir la galera que protege su horno artesanal de su vivienda, cancelara un crédito con otra institución y para instalar la energía eléctrica en su casa. Con la inversión él ya no tendrá que buscar prestadas las instalaciones para hornear el pan y para tener su maquinaria. Así, producirá su propio pan para la venta y recibir buenas ganancias que le permitan brindar a su familia todo lo necesario. Su objetivo es adquirir un terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en:
José, age 40, is married and has seven children.  He has been making bread since he was nine years old.  It was his parents who taught him how to do this.  In order to buy the materials that he needs, he travels in his vehicle to the city.

The loan that he is requesting from the Fundación Campo is to rebuild the galley that protects the handcrafted oven at his house, to pay off a loan with another institution, and to install electricity in his house.  With the investment he will not have to look to borrow equipment to bake the bread and to have machinery.  

This way he will produce his own bread to sell.  He will get good income, which will allow him to provide his family with everything they need.  His objective is to get a piece of land in order to build a house.

loans.use: to rebuild the galley that protects the handcrafted oven at his house, to pay off a loan with another institution, and to install electricity in his house.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is 29 years old. She is married to a businessman. They have two children. She sells seeds and fertilizers of different kinds. With the profits, she wants to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more seeds and fertilizers for sale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is an active micro-finance member of PMPC.  She is 49 years old, married with two adult-aged children and one school-aged child.  She lives in Olo, Siquijor, Siquijor.  She has been selling fish for 12 years with average monthly earnings of Php 2,000.  She took out a loan in PMPC to purchase more fish to sell.  She plans to use the profit from business to support the daily needs of her family.  She hopes that someday the living conditions of the family will improve.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Antoine

texts.en:
Antoine is a 62-year-old married man, father of three children. He has worked as a blacksmith since 2000, and this long experience provided him with a very good reputation in the region. He also works as a math teacher to cover his family's expenses. Antoine is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua for the first time, in order to buy a power generator that is very important for his business development, since electricity is a major problem in Lebanon with no clue that it will be solved soon.

Antoine is working hard on expanding his business as much as he can to keep on providing his family the necessary living needs.

loans.use: To buy a power generator

loans.name: Lirisia Monserrate

texts.es:
EL  Banco Comunal Los Tamarindos se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad del Valle, ciudad de clima cálido de hermosas mujeres y con una gran variedad en su gastronomía.

La señora Lirisia tiene 45 años de edad, está casada pero aun no ha podido tener  hijos. Su esposo es maestro.
 
Ella una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar con la finalidad de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella es maestra y trabaja en las mañanas en un jardín de infantes y en la tarde en un colegio de la localidad pero también se dedica al comercio, vende productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale en las noches cuando puede y también vende en los lugares donde ella labora, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 14 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos ya que según dice son muy buenos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, entre otros productos. Lleva más de 15 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es tener un bebe algún dia.
texts.en:
Los Tamarindos Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the beautiful city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known as the City of the Valley, a city of warm climate, pretty women, and great variety in its cuisine.

Lirisia, 45, is married but hasn't been able to have a baby yet.  Her husband is a teacher.  She's determined and likes to work, with the goal of helping her husband with the household expenses.  She's a teacher and works in a kindergarten in the morning and a school in the town in the afternoon.

She also works in business selling Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories).  She sells door-to-door at night when she can, and also in her workplace.  She leaves the products on credit and collects weekly.  She has been doing this work for more than 14 years and it's going very well for her.  What she sells most are perfumes and cosmetics because they say they're very good.

This loan is to buy perfume, cream, cosmetics, and other products.  She has been with the community bank for more than 15 years and she likes it because the payments are easy to make.

Her dream is to have a baby one day.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cream, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Josefa, ella tiene  68 años de edad, es viuda y tuvo 5 hijos los cuales son personas adultas y de provecho, ella se dedica  al  comercio de verduras y hortalizas en general, granos como maíz, y los comercializa de forma directa a sus clientes en los diferentes mercados de su comunidad. 
Josefa está solicitando el préstamo para comprar mercadería como maíz y verduras para capitalizar su comercio. La Socia está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, por ayudarla a fortalecer  y hacer crecer su actividad económica. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón Salvador del Mundo”; del distrito de San Salvador de la provincia de Calca del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Josefa is 68 years old.  She is widowed and had five children who are now hard-working adults.  Josefa sells greens, vegetables in general, and grains such as corn.  She sells these products directly to her customers in different markets in her community. 

Josefa is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as corn and vegetables to capitalize her business.  She is very grateful for Kiva's help which will enable her to strengthen and grow her business.  Josefa belongs to the 'Patrón Salvador del Mundo' community bank which is located in San Salvador district, in Calca province, Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy corn and vegetables

loans.name: Lelia

texts.en:
Lelia has been an active micro-finance member of PMPC since 2010. She is 54 years old, widowed and has four children.  

She has been engaged in making and selling homemade bread for three years, earning a monthly average of PHP 2,000.  

She took another loan from PMPC to purchase additional ingredients to make homemade bread for sale. She will use the profit to support the daily needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients to make bread.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa lives at Lalog 1 with her spouse and children. 

To make a living, her spouse provides daily motorcycle transport services to the people in their village. This way, the family earns about PHP 300 each day and has just enough for meals and daily expenses. 

Elsa would like to make improvements on their business so that their income will increase. She would like to ask for a loan of PHP 15,000 to pay for franchise renewal and buy tires and crude oil for the motorcycle.
