Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta  su trabajo pues le genera un ingreso económico, que le permite saciar sus necesidades, y dar una buena educación a sus hijos.  No le gusta el cansancio físico para la elaboración de sus panes, pero eso no la desanima y nos comenta que espera seguir creciendo y así poder construir su  propio horno. Este es el  préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, se siente feliz por forma parte de un grupo responsable, que  le da la confianza de seguir trabajando, y se siente agradecida con la institución MFP por el apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio.
Con el préstamo solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles, comprará materiales para la elaboración de sus panes como harinas, mantecas, levaduras y demás, en mayores cantidades, para así tener mejores ganancias. También en la compra de un horno a gas valorizado en 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Gemima, 29, is a charismatic and enterprising woman. She separated from the father of her two children, she loves them and works hard to be able to provide the best for them.

She lives in her own home with her sister, her children and her brother-in-law. Her work is to make and sell breads, a role which she learnt at an occupational training centre. She started her business, for which she relies on a clay baker's oven in her home, but unfortunately it experienced a problem and has broken so she is temporarily making bread on a rented gas oven.

She started her business over a year ago, in which time she has become well know because of the quality of her products, she relies on the help of her sister who helps her to make and sell the bread. She considers her business to be profitable because of the good income that it provides.

She likes her job as it provides economic income, which allows her to buy necessities and to give her children a good education. She doesn't like the fact that making bread is physically exhausting, but this doesn't demotivate her and she tells us that she hopes to keep growing her business and to be able to build her own oven.

This is her second loan from MFP, she is happy to be part of a responsible group that gives her the confidence to keep working and she feels grateful to MFP for the financial support to take her business forward.

With the requested 1200 nuevos soles, she will buy materials for making bread like flour, butter, yeast and other things at wholesale quantities so that she can have a better return. She will also buy a gas oven valued at 1000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: to purchase flour, lard, yeast, and a gas oven in order to not have to rent an oven

loans.name: Adilia

texts.es:
Adilia, de 44 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser amable y alegre. Es conviviente con Alejandro quien se dedica al transporte y es padre de sus hijos por quienes se esfuerza en salir adelante. Juntos viven en su casa propia que compró con el apoyo de su pareja. La actividad que realiza Adilia es la venta de pescado frescos que compra por las madrugas en el puerto de la localidad para luego llevarlos a vender en su puesto en el mercado de la ciudad, atendiendo de manera amable y atenta a sus clientes que siempre le consumen sus productos.
Se inició hace más de 5 años con un capital propio, gracias a la iniciativa de su hermana quien la animó viendo las necesidades que sufría y hasta el momento lo viene realizando ella sola.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja, y porque logra acabar con todos su mercadería que oferta.
Antes de empezar con su negocio sufría muchas  dificultades por la escasez de trabajo, además le gusta los negocios y busco generarse sus propios ingresos para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar.
Por tanto, ahora viendo los ingresos obtenidos desea ampliar y seguir creciendo, además de querer abrir una tienda de abarrotes.  Este es el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP. Por ello cuenta con su colaboración para  concretar sus planes. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal, por el apoyo que vienen brindando a las personas con negocio y lo considera un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de su mercadería que es el pescado fresco buscando precios bajos por sus compras  al contado y en volumen, además realzará arreglos en su casa para acondicionar una bodega para la venta de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Adilia is 44 years old. She is a hard worker and an enterprising woman, as well as kind and cheerful. She lives with her partner Alejandro, who works in transportation and is the father of her children. She does her best to get ahead for them. They live together in the home they own, which she bought  with help from her partner. Adilia's business is selling fresh fish, which she buys in the early morning at the local harbor and then sells at the stall she has in the city market. She sees to her customers kindly and attentively and they come back for her products.

She started out with her own capital over five years ago by her sister's initiative, who encouraged her to get started when she saw her in need. So far she has been managing her business on her own, and she thinks it is quite profitable because it provides her with good earnings and because she is able to sell all of her merchandise.

Before starting her business she used to have a lot of problems due to lack of work. But she likes business and she found a way to generate her own income to help her partner with home expenses. So now, in light of the income she has obtained, she would like to expand and keep growing, and also to open a grocery at home. 

This is her fourth loan with the institution MFP, so has their cooperation in order to realize her plans. She is also comfortable with her communal bank because they offer support to business owners and she considers it a united and supportive group.

She will invest the requested amount of 1,000 nuevos soles in the purchase of merchandise. She will buy fresh fish and find low prices by paying in cash and purchasing in bulk. She will also make repairs in her house so that she can set up a grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase fish, and airconditioning for her home to start a grocery store business

loans.name: Fortune Womens Group

texts.en:
In this group are Juliet, Rehema, Agnes, Grace, Allen, Phionah, Marion, Frigensiya, Celia, Robinah, Glades, Tereeza, Clemencia and Noredah. From left to right, Rehema is the second person standing in a red blouse and black dress.

Fortune Womens group is located on the outskirts of Ibanda town. The group is comprised of only women whose major activity is agriculture. They fall into different categories including divorcees, widows, single mothers and married women.
 
Rehema is a single mother of six children. She lost her husband three years ago. Among her six children, four are in school. She also takes care of her son’s two children because their parents failed to raise their school fees.

Rehema is mainly an agriculturalist who grows crops and raises pigs and goats. She supplements the farming with income from a small retail shop with capital of UGX 100,000. She resorted to farming in 2009 after losing her husband, so that she could provide the basic needs of her children and pay their school fees.

She will use the loan to buy pigs to sell, feed for her pigs, stock for the business and to pay school fees for her children. Her customers are her neighbors and passersby. The main challenge is lack of enough manpower to look after the pigs and goats and lack of good feed for her pigs, which affects her cash flow.  Despite all these challenges, Rehema is a very hard working, trustworthy and honest woman, which has increased the number of her customers and allowed her to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: To buy pigs to sell

loans.name: Mariama's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org with headquarters in Makeni city in Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you for the second time, this group of teachers from Kenema, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. Having repaid their last Kiva loan successfully, they have again come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a new loan of 15,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones. With the help of this new loan, they will be able to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will then repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. Their bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayment to SMT/Kiva lenders on their behalf. 

Mariama is the leader of this group of teachers. Mariama is 35. She is married and has 1 child who is attending primary school. Mariama has been in the teaching profession for 9 years now. She has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials like corrugated iron zincs, cements, nails, etc. for the completion of a family house she began building with her first Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy house building materials like corrugated iron zincs, cements, nails, etc. for the completion of a family house she began building with her first Kiva loan

loans.name: Gunter

texts.es:
Gunter, de 58 años, es un hombre impetuoso y muy trabajador, durante toda su vida ha trabajado para llevar una vida tranquila al lado de su familia, lleva una relación de convivencia con María con quien tiene 8 hijos que son mayores de edad, vive junto a su cónyuge, su hijo y su nuera en su casa propia que pudo edificar gracias a muchos años de esfuerzo y constancia en su trabajo. Gunter, se dedica a la venta de productos regionales, tiene una chacra propia donde siembra diversos cultivos como yuca, coco, naranja, limones y distintas frutas tropicales que cosecha cada dos días y que posteriormente pone a la venta de forma ambulatoria en el mercado principal de la ciudad. En épocas de baja producción la cosecha es semanal y en ese período realiza otras funciones para asegurar su solvencia. Algunas veces compra de otros productores algunos productos que no tiene sembrados pero que son solicitados por sus clientes. Lleva en esta actividad más de 2 años y le va muy  bien. Trabaja con la ayuda de su conviviente quien le apoya en las ventas y en la atención a sus clientes.  Por las noches trabaja como guardián de un fundo ganadero que le genera un ingreso económico adicional. Está muy contento porque ambas actividades le están dando buenos resultados, anteriormente su mayor problema era la dificultad que tenía para trasladar sus productos a la ciudad debido a las malas condiciones de la carretera, además la ausencia de mano de obra en su sector no le permitía realizar la cosecha en el tiempo previsto, sin embargo todas esas condiciones han mejorado y ahora trabaja adecuadamente y con mejores resultados. Este es el préstamo número 5 con MFP, por lo tanto agradece a todas las personas que siguen confiando en él para acceder nuevamente a este financiamiento que le ayudará a aumentar su capital de trabajo, sabe que nuevamente tendrá que ser muy responsable y sobre todo muy puntual, está contento de pertenecer su banco comunal ya que ve que son muy solidarios.
El monto solicitado 2500 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de distintos productos regionales como yuca y cítricos, además comprará plátano y carnes de reses y aves, pues ha visto que tienen gran demanda entre la población.
texts.en:
Gunter, 58, is an impetuous and hard-working man. He’s worked all of his life to lead a quiet life beside his family. He has an agreeable relationship with Maria, with whom he has 8 children who are all the age of majority. He lives with wife, his son and his daughter-in-law in his own house that he was able to build thanks to many years of effort and perseverance in his work. Gunter sells products from the region; he has a small farm where he sows an array of crops, like yucca, coconut, orange, lemons and different tropical fruits that he harvests every second day and then walks around selling them in the city’s main market. During low-yield periods, the harvest is done weekly and he does other functions in order to ensure that there’s income. Sometimes he buys products from other producers because his clients ask for them and he doesn’t grow them. He’s been doing this for the last 2 years and it’s going well. He works with his wife who supports him in sales and attention to the customer. In the evenings, he works as a guard at a cattle farm to generate additional income. He’s very happy because both jobs are having good results. Before, his biggest problems included difficulty in transporting his goods to the city because of the terrible road conditions, and lack of manual labor in his sector, which didn’t allow for him to finish harvesting in the allotted time. Nevertheless all of these conditions have improved and he now works adequately and with better results. This is loan number 5 with the MFP. He’s grateful to all the people who continue to believe in him and allow him to access this new loan, which will help him increase his business capital. He knows he’ll have to responsible once again, and moreover, punctual. He’s happy to be a member of the communal bank as they are very united.
He’s asking for 2500 soles, which he’ll invest in different regional products, like yucca and citrus fruit. He’ll also buy banana and cattle and bird meat as he’s seen that there’s a demand for it in the population.

loans.use: buy yucca, citrus fruits, banana and wild animal meat.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María de 27 años de edad, es una mujer laboriosa, vive con su pareja Hernán de 33 años; junto a sus 02 queridos hijos, viven en su propia casa a base de madera. María, se dedica a labrar la tierra para cultivar plantas de café; esta labor lleva realizando junto a su pareja hace más de 7 años y comenta que en los tiempos de cosecha siempre cuenta con el apoyo de jornaleros. María y su pareja siempre están al cuidado de sus plantas, porque siempre le remuneran buenas ganancias por su cosecha; sin embargo a veces le cuesta cargar los sacos de cosecha, hasta conseguir una movilidad para llevar sus granos hasta los centros de acopio; aun así ellos continúan con su trabajo. Es por ello que desde que trabajan con los prestamos logran tener una buena producción de café para la mejora de su calidad de vida. éste es su crédito número 02; agradece por el apoyo que le brindan y asegura ser responsable con sus cuotas de pago. En su banco comunal, es una socia activa. Con los 500 nuevos soles, comprar funguicidas para la buena producción de sus plantas de café.
texts.en:
María, age 27, is a hardworking woman. She lives with her partner Hernán, age 33, together with their two beloved children. They live in their own home which is made of wood. 

María works the land to grow coffee plants; she's been doing this work together with her partner for more than seven years, and she says that during harvesting periods she always counts on the support of day laborers. María and her partner are always taking care of their plants, because their crop always pays good earnings. However, sometimes it's difficult for her to carry the harvest sacks, to the point that they get transportation to take her beans to the supply centers. Even so they continue on with their labors. 

That's why, since they worked with loans, they have achieved a good coffee production for the improvement of their quality of life. This is her second loan; she appreciates the support that's offered to her and assures that she will be responsible with her payment requirements. She is an active member of her community bank. 

With the 500 nuevos soles (PEN), she will buy fungicides for a good production from her coffee plants.

loans.use: to buy fungicides for her plants.

loans.name: Jennyfer

texts.es:
Jennyfer, de 23 años es una mujer honesta, humilde y muy trabajadora, convive con Juan quien es el padre de su hija de 5 años llamada Anny, además tiene 5 meses de embarazo y por ello se siente muy emocionada, vive junto a ellos en la casa de su madre en donde le asignaron un espacio para habitarlo y continuar luchando para mejorar su nivel de vida. El trabajo de Jennyfer consiste en la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad. Instaló su pequeña tienda en una sección del espacio que habita en la casa de su madre. Ella se encarga de comprar mensualmente los productos que pone a la venta al por mayor, ya sean en paquetes, en sacos o por cajas, luego los distribuye al menudeo logrando obtener muy buenas ganancias por sus ventas, una vez distribuidos en su tienda los ofrece al público dando un trato agradable a cada uno de los clientes que acuden a comprar en su tienda. Lleva en este negocio cerca de 3 meses debido a su estado de gestación, normalmente trabaja desde hace 5 años vendiendo prendas de vestir, labor que por ahora ha dejado en estado inactivo para llevar un embarazo sin complicaciones y por ahora solo se dedica a la venta de abarrotes. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que las ventas sierre son frecuentes, es la única bodega que hay en su barrio y eso le permite vender continuamente y al final del día puede ver que su esfuerzo es recompensado con las ganancias que recibe. Espera poder ampliar su tienda, implementarla con mayor diversidad de productos y mantener la clientela que ha logrado conseguir hasta el momento. Este es el crédito número 2 con MFP, por tanto agradece a todos los que hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, ella por su parte se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son personas muy amables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de productos de primera necesidad para implementar su pequeña tienda como por ejemplo: arroz, azúcar, verduras, tubérculos, granos y gaseosas.
texts.en:
Jennyfer, an honest, humble, and hardworking 23-year-old woman, lives with Juan, who is the father of her five-year-old daughter, Anny. She is also five months pregnant, and she feels very excited about that. She lives with Juan and Anny in her mother's house, where they have allocated them a space to live and continue struggling to improve their standard of living. 

Jennifer's work consists of selling groceries and staple products. She set up her little shop in a section of the space where they live in her mother's house. Each month, she buys the products that she sells from the wholesaler, whether they be in packages, sacks, or by the case. Then she sells them at retail, managing to get very good profits for her sales. Once they are stocked in her shop, she offers the products to the public, giving special treatment to every customer who comes into her store to shop. She has been in this business for three months because of her pregnancy. For the last five years, she was working selling clothing; she has set aside this work for now in order to have an uncomplicated pregnancy, and for now she just works selling groceries.

What she likes about her business is that her sales are frequent; it's the only food shop in her neighborhood, and that allows her to sell continually. At the end of the day, she can see that her efforts are paying off in the profits that she makes. She hopes to be able to increase the size of her shop, stocking it with a better selection of products and maintaining the clientele that she has built so far. 

This is her second loan with MFP, so she is grateful to all those who have made her loan possible so she can continue toward her goals. For her part, she promises to make her loan payments in a timely manner. She is very happy to belong to her communal bank, as all its members are very kind and supportive people.

With the amount she is requesting, she will buy a larger quantity of staple products to stock her small shop, including rice, sugar, vegetables, tubers, grains, and sodas.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, vegetables, tubers, grains, and sodas.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Joko

texts.en: Joko is 45 years old and live in West Point. She did not attend school and has three children. One of them attends school. Joko has been selling cosmetics for the past 4 years and she enjoys it a lot. She’s requesting a loan to buy more cosmetic for her business; she plans and hopes to be a successful business woman and build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Philbert

texts.en:
Philbert is 22 years old and is single. His business is well organized and he sells various goods such as lotion, juice, biscuits, soft drinks, etc. 

Philbert has requested a loan from Kiva lenders through Vision Finance in order to buy various goods such as lotion, juice, biscuits, soft drinks, etc. for resale. With the profit from this loan, he will be able to reinvest in his business and to save for his future.

loans.use: To buy various goods such as lotion, juice, biscuits, soft drinks, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more coconut wine to resell

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru:
Людмила арендует  магазин на рынке, где она продает строительные крепления. В этом году перед выборами власти выдали деньги на ремонт крыш больницам и школам. Появился повышенный спрос на крепежные материалы. Людмила просит предоставить ей кредит, чтобы закуписть крепеж, метизы и болты для строительных бригад, которые работают по ремонту крыш. 

В семье Людмилы произошли положительные изменения. Родилась внучка, а внук пошел в школу в первый класс. А саоме главное - муж Людмилы бросил пить. На вопрос как он это сделал, Людмила говорит, что просто начала его больше любить!
texts.en:
Ludmila rents a store at the market, where she sells adhesives and fasteners for construction work. This year, before the election, the authorities granted money to repair roofs of hospitals and schools. There was increased demand for adhesives and fasteners. 

Ludmila requests us to give her a loan in order to purchase fasteners, hardware and screws for construction workers, who work with repairing roofs. 

There have been positive changes in Ludmila's family. A granddaughter was born, and the grandson started going to school, in the first year. And most important - Ludmila's husband quit drinking. When asked how he did this, Ludmila says that she simply started loving him more!

loans.use: to purchase adhesives and fasteners for selling to construction workers

loans.name: Nazura

texts.ru:
Назуре 40 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Назура в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес 7 лет назад с суммы в 4,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Назуры в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 4 дойные коровы с приплодом, 3 нетели,5 овец, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 12,000 сом (KGS). 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Назура обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 65,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку 2 нетелей.  Доходы от кредита Назура планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса посредством увеличения поголовья племенного скота, а также планирует обучить детей.
texts.en:
Nazura is 40 years old, married and has four children. As a main source of income for her family, Nazura is engaged in livestock breeding, after having started this business 7 years ago with a sum of 4,000 som (KGS). Thanks to persistent work, Nazura today has four dairy cows with offspring, three heifers and five sheep at her farm. The monthly income from the farm is around 12,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Nazura turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 65,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of two heifers. Nazura plans to invest the income from the loan in developing her business by increasing the number of breeding stock. She also plans to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase two heifers

loans.name: Dy's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, Dy is a 27-year-old mother of two daughters. Her daughters are dependent on her and still in school. The main source of the family’s income is from rice farming on a 1.5-hectare area of farmland. Dy has been engaged in this business for several years. She earns about 9,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 4,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. The low price of her crop yield is still her main business challenge.

Dy’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. Both of them are in the first-time microloan program with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. Dy is leading her group to request a loan of 500,000 KHR each. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and pay for labor fees. She hopes this loan will help her to improve her productivity so she can sell the rice for a good price and earn a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna, de 31 años de edad, convive con su pareja y tiene 02 hijos, Johns de 11 años, y Yanelu  de 07 años de edad. Juntos viven en su casa  propia. La actividad que realiza Reyna, es labrar la tierra en su propia chacra que hace 15 años llego a adquirir con mucho esmero. Reyna junto a su pareja elaboran el cuidado de sus plantas de café. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es poder ver los apreciados frutos que con el tiempo le resulta  beneficioso por la manera como efectúa su producción; por otra parte considera difícil que las plagas afecten sus siembras ya que son difíciles de lidiarlas. Es por eso que acude a MFP para requerir un préstamo en cual ayude con sus objetivos de trabajo. Con el tiempo su mayor anhelo es comprar plantas de café para luego cultivar en su terreno. Este es su crédito número 02, por el se compromete a pagar durante las fechas establecidas, además, se siente conforme por las buenas decisiones que toma su banco comunal.
Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, contratará jornales para que puedan ayudarle en el desyerbo de malezas.
texts.en:
Reyna, 31, lives with her partner and has two children, Johns, 11, and Yanelu, 7.  Together they live in their own house.  Reyna's job is working the land on her own farm, which she acquired 15 years ago with great care.  Reyna and her partner take care of the coffee plants.

What she likes most about her job is being able to see the valued fruits that over time are beneficial because of how they affect her crop.  On the other hand, what's difficult is that pests affect her crops because they're hard to fight.

This is why she's coming to MFP for a loan to help her with her work objectives.  In time, her greatest desire is to buy coffee plants to grow on her land.  This is her second loan and she pledges to make her payments by the established deadlines.  In addition, she's satisfied with the good decisions her communal bank makes.

With the 1,500 nuevos soles [PEN] she'll hire day laborers to help her with the weeding.

loans.use: to hire day laborers

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
59 years old, Phan is a married mother of nine children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Her family lives in a rural area of the Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district of Cambodia. Growing rice is the main source of her family’s income. She has been engaged in this business for fifteen years. The current business earns her around 13 USD per day; she manages to save approximately 4 USD each day after daily expenses. 

This is Phan's first microloan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She is applying for a loan of 800 USD. With this loan, she is going to buy materials for building a decent house, such as doors, windows, zincs, etc. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a proper house for living in, so she can pay more attention to generating more income for her family and keeping her children in school.

loans.use: To buy materials for building a decent house

loans.name: Koern

texts.en:
Koern, 60 years old, is a farmer who lives in a rural area of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Cambodia. She has seven children. She has been a rice farmer for 30 years. From the current business, she is able to earn approximately 8 USD per day. She saves about 5 USD each day after daily expenses. Low crop yield is the main challenge for her rice-paddy business.

Koern is in her first microloan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She is requesting a loan with VisionFund of 500 USD. She is going to use this loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to pay for labor costs. She hopes this loan will enable her to improve rice production so she can sell it for a good price, in order to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Zahriniso

texts.en: Zahriniso is married and has two children who are 3 and 5 years old. She has always wanted to provide them with a good education. Since her husband’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, she decided to start a new business in animal husbandry. This new business will help generate income that she can contribute to her home’s finances. She studied the course of ‘How to Get Ahead’ at a women's organization, and learned many business skills. She is asking for a loan of 500 Somoni to buy cattle for starting her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for starting her new business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
This is Ismael. He previously accessed a 16,000 PHP loan that he used to pay for spare parts, accessories, and the maintenance of his tricycle unit. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children, as well as for his personal, household and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another 18,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts, provide maintenance for his tricycle unit, and to buy some equipment for his repair shop. The profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his family's daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Ismael dreams of having a beautiful future. He hopes that his children will finish their education. He faithfully meets with his co-fellowship members every week to share stories of his work and to study the Word of God. It is through these studies that he can draw strength and inspiration. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle.

loans.name: Eudia

texts.en: Eudia is 45 years old. She sells fruits and vegetables. She has been in business for 15 years. She wants the loan to buy more carrots and eggplants for sale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more carrots and eggplants for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Eylene

texts.en:
Eyelyne is 45 years old and lives in West Point. She is married and has four children between 4 and 14 years old who live with her and attend school. Since 2003, she has been selling book bags in the local market. She enjoys it a lot, since she has many customers.
She’s requesting a loan to purchase book bags for her business. She plans to build her house and live a good life.

loans.use: to purchase book bags for sale in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an assortment of fruits and vegetables to then increase his sales.

loans.name: Sokhorn's Group

texts.en:
Sokhorn, 30, lives in a rural village in the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Cambodia. She has two children, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. To support the family, she has been planting rice for five years, while her husband complements their income by working as a paid construction worker in the local area. Sokhorn and her husband can earn approximately 24,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 8,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. 

Her group consists of two members, and they are first-time VisionFund borrowers. Sokhorn and her group member are applying for a loan of 600,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to pay labor fees for plowing the field and transplanting rice seedlings. She hopes her crop yield will become more profitable and productive so as to make a good living for her family.

loans.use: to pay labor fees for plowing the field and transplanting rice seedling

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 27 years old and is married with one child who is five years old. His business is well organized. He starts at 8 am and works until 8 pm every day. He has three years of experience with one person to help him. 

Emmanuel has requested a loan from Kiva partner Vision Finance Company in order to buy more soft drinks (fanta, beer for sorghum) for resale. With the profit from this loan, Emmanuel will pay his children's school fees and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks (fanta, beer for sorghum) for resale

loans.name: Maria Aurora

texts.es:
Maria es una gran luchadora que ha trabajado fuertemente en la vida para salir adelante, y es por esto que hace 4 meses logró montar su propio negocio después de haber trabajado por más de 25 años como empleada en la venta de productos de uso personal. Ahora que tiene su propio negocio de venta de productos de uso personal, puede ofrecerles a sus 3 hijos una mejor calidad de vida, pues el negocio está ubicado en un local que tiene su casa y esto le permite estar al cuidado de sus 3 hijos todo el tiempo. Pese a las grandes dificultades económicas que padece su familia, el negocio ha podido ir saliendo adelante poco a poco, y gracias a que ahora tiene buenas ventas, Maria busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal y surtir su negocio.

Su sueño es seguir sacando adelante este negocio y que le permita obtener ingresos con los cuales supere las grandes dificultades económicas del hogar, y así pueda darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos que tanto la ha buscado.
texts.en:
Maria is a very determined woman who works hard in life to get ahead and this is why four months ago she succeeded in setting up her own business.  Before, she had been working for more than 25 years as an employee in personal product sales.  Now that she has her own business of selling personal products she can offer her three children a better quality of life because her business is located in the same place as her house, which allows her to be there to care for her three children at all times.  

Despite the financial difficulty that her family is suffering from, the business has been able to get them ahead little by little and thanks to the good sales she is now having, Maria asks for a loan to buy personal products and to stock up her business.

Her dream is to continue moving forward in the business so that it will allow her to get an income with which she can overcome the large financial difficulties of her home, and thus be able to provide a better quality of life for her children as she has sought to do.

loans.use: To buy personal products and to stock up her business.

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru: Нигина очень трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина. Ей 26 лет. Она разведена и на воспитании имеет дочь. Уже 2 месяца как она  в мотивации организовать собственный бизнес, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого.  С целью организовать свой бизнес, она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей  обуви, так как ее брат занимается этом видом бизнеса и хочет помочь Нигине. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить себя и дочь со всеми необходимыми средствами. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nigina is a very hardworking and dedicated woman. She is 26 years old. She is divorced and raising a daughter. For 2 months already, she has been motivated to start her own business, but doesn't have sufficient funds to do so.  To organize your business, she took the "Bring Success" course, organized by the women's business association, and received a certificate. She wants to organize a business of buying and selling shoes, because her brother is engaged in this kind of business and wants to help Nigina. With the income, she plans to provide herself and her daughter with all necessities. She asks for a loan for the amount of 2,000 somoni for the purchase of goods to start a new business. She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy shoes and start a shoe business

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz Maria hace mucho tiempo trabajaba con la actividad de la crianza de pollos, pero por situaciones adversas a su voluntad tuvo que dejar esta actividad y comenzó a trabajar en fincas como mayordomo. Como sus empleadores no la dejaban continuar con el negocio dentro de sus fincas, Luz Maria había abandonado esta actividad completamente. Pero ahora que se encuentra trabajando en una finca donde su empleador si le permite tener la crianza de los pollos, Luz Maria quiere reiniciar su actividad y para esto pide un préstamo para comprar los pollos, el cuido para alimentarlos y adecuar el corral para criarlos; y así poder reiniciar con la actividad.

Su sueño es poder tener una buena calidad de vida y ofrecer en su hogar un mayor apoyo económico, de modo que su esposo y sus 5 hijos puedan tener mejores oportunidades para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Luz Maria has worked for a long time raising chickens. Due to adverse situations she had to stop this activity against her will and started to work as a caretaker at farms. Since her employers didn't let her continue with her business at their farms, Luz Maria stopped this activity completely. But now she is working at a farm where her employer does let her raise the chickens. Luz Maria wants to re-start her activity and to do that she is asking for a loan to buy the chickens and feed for them, as well as to set up the pen to raise them in. This way, she can re-start her activity.

Her dream is to have a good quality of life and offer more financial support to her home so that her husband and 5 children can have better opportunuties to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed for them as well as set up the pen to raise them and be able to restart her activity.

loans.name: Bertha Miryam

texts.es:
Bertha siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora, y esto le ha permitido superar grandes dificultades que se le han presentado en la vida. La mayor dificultad que tiene es ser madre soltera cabeza de hogar de sus 2 hijos, y como su esposo la abandonó una vez nació su segundo hijo, desde hace 9 años Bertha montó una tienda general donde ofrece a sus clientes productos de la canasta familiares y otros productos comestibles. Tiene una muy buena ventaja en su negocio que es el poder estar ubicada en un punto donde circulan muchas personas, pero no ha podido aprovechar esta ventaja por no tener el capital suficiente; es por esto que Bertha ahora busca un préstamo para comprar productos de la canasta familiar y otros comestibles para surtir su negocio y ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes, para así aumentar sus ventas.

Bertha espera que así sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente porque brindará una mejor atención a las personas. Su sueño es poder terminar de construir su propia casa que la tiene en obra negra.
texts.en:
Bertha has always characterized herself as being very hardworking, and this has allowed her to overcome great difficulties in her life. The biggest difficulty she has is being a single mother head of household for her two children, since her husband abandoned her once her second child was born. Nine years ago Bertha set up a general store where she offers basic necessities and other edible products to her customers. She has a very good advantage in her business which is being located at a point where many people circulate, but she hasn't been able to make the most out of this advantage because she hasn't had enough capital. This is why Bertha is now looking for a loan to buy products such as basic necessities and other edibles in order to supply her business and offer a better variety of products to her customers, in order to increase her sales.

Bertha hopes that in this way her income will increase considerably because she'll be able to attend to people better. Her dream is to be able to finish building her own home, which is currently unfinished.

loans.use: to buy basic necessities and other edible goods to supply her business and offer better variety of products to her customers, in order to increase her sales.

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.ru: Тахмина это женщина, которая успевает делать все. Она везде любимая и всегда завершает успешно, начитаю работу. Ей  27 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Тахмина уже несколько лет занимается купле продажей женской одежды, но этот вид бизнеса не удовлетворяет ее. Она планирует организовать новый бизнес купле продажей сухофруктов. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Tahmina is a woman who manages to do everything. She is loved everywhere and always completes her work successfully. She is 27 years old. She is married and is raising two children. Tahmina has been involved in the sale of women's clothing already for several years, but this kind of business did not satisfy her. She plans to start a new business buying and reselling dried fruits. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 1,500 somoni for the purchase of goods to start a new business. She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy dried fruits to start a dried fruit business

loans.name: Hean

texts.en:
Hean is a 39-year-old mother of one child who is a dependent and helps the family’s business. She lives in a rural area of the Ratanak Mondul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been growing corn for four years. She is able to earn about 20,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 8,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. Lacking working capital to support her current business is her main challenge.

Hean has been with VisionFund for one cycle and fully repaid the past loan, which has helped her to better support her family and provide them sufficient food. Now she is requesting a new loan with VisionFund of 3,000,000 KHR. With this loan, she is going to buy seeds and pesticides for her plantation and use a portion of it to pay for labor costs. She hopes this loan will enable her to get a high crop yield that she can sell for a good price in order to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pesticides for her plantation

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 32 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara, Uganda. He has 4 children, with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, James has been working hard to manage his electronics shop, which sells light bulbs, oil, cables, and circuits. 

To help expand his business, James has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more electrical wire, tape, and other electronic necessities, and will help James to generate greater profits and grow the business with the expanded sales. James hopes that in the future he will be able to start another wholesale business. 

James is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like James who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more electrical wire, tape, and other electronic necessities

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos es un joven emprendedor de 20 años de edad que estudió publicidad y ahora quiere comenzar con su propio negocio, por esto ahora está buscando la manera de abrir su propia agencia de publicidad y como no cuenta con los recursos para ello, busca un préstamo para adecuar el local que ha alquilado, legalizar la empresa y hacer publicidad.

Gracias a su dedicación ha podido ir poco a poco saliendo adelante y ahora que tiene la oportunidad espera poder aportar económicamente en su hogar para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus padres y sus hermanos. Su sueño es sacar adelante su propia empresa y durar mucho tiempo con ella, para generar empleo y ayudar a otros a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is an enterprising young man of 20 years who studied advertising and now wants to start up his own business. This is why he's currently looking for a way to open his own advertising agency, and since he doesn't have the resources to do that, he's looking for a loan to be able to adapt the place he rented, legalize his business, and advertise.

Thanks to his dedication he's been able to move forward little by little, coming out ahead, and now that he has the opportunity he hopes to be able to contribute financially to his home, in order to improve the quality of life for his parents and siblings. His dream is to get his own business ahead and stick with it a long time, to create employment and help others come out ahead.

loans.use: to adapt the place he has rented, legalize his business, and advertise.

loans.name: Busaira

texts.ru:
Бусайре 60 лет, имеет 5 детей. Бусайра в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес 8 лет назад с суммы в 4,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Бусайры в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 3 дойные коровы с приплодом, 2 лошади, 30 голов мелкого рогатого скота, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бусайра обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку 10 овец.  Доходы от кредита Бусайра планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса посредством увеличения поголовья скота, и в ближайшем времени планирует реконструировать площадь сарая для обеспечении хороших условий содержания скота.
texts.en:
Busaira is 60 years and has five children. Busaira, as the main source of income for her family, is engaged in cattle breeding. She started this business eight years ago with the amount of 4,000 som (KGS). Thanks to the hard work of Busaira, in her business today she has three milk cows to breed, two horses, and 30 head of cattle, with monthly income from farming at about 10,000 som.

In order to further develop her business, Busaira appealed to the organization "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of 10 sheep. With income from the loan, Busaira plans to invest in the development of her business by increasing the number of livestock, and soon plans to remodel the barn area to ensure good conditions for her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Cheangly's Group

texts.en:
Cheangly is a 29-year-old mother of two children, all of whom are dependent on her and too young for school. Her family lives in the Kror Kor district of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She has made a living through farming rice for several years and raising pigs. She is able to earn about 15,000 KHR per day and can manage to save about 10,000 KHR every day, after deducting daily expenses. Insufficient working capital to support her current business is still her main challenge.

Cheangly’s group consists of two members who are both females. She is in her first loan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She and her group member are seeking for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy pig feed for her pig-raising business. She hopes this loan will fatten her pigs to sell them for a good price in order to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy pig feed for her pig-raising business

loans.name: Robert Arturo

texts.es:
Robert ha llegado a la ciudad de Medellín proveniente de Perú gracias a que conoció a su esposa y en esta ciudad se han radicado. Ya lleva 3 años en la ciudad de Medellín y para generar los ingresos para su hogar tiene un negocio de cibercafé donde además vende productos de papelería. Robert está estudiando publicidad, y ahora para poder ejercer algunas de las actividades, requiere la compra de una máquina, pero como no cuenta con el dinero suficiente, busca un préstamo para comprar una máquina termofijadora y poder ofrecer trabajos de publicidad en su negocio.

Su sueño es poder tener un gran negocio, ejercer su carrera de publicista y así mejorar los ingresos para que en un futuro pueda comprarse una casa propia para vivir junto con su esposa.
texts.en:
Robert arrived in Medellín from Peru because he met his wife and they came to live in this city. He has been in Medellín for 3 years and to generate income for his home he has a cyber cafe where he also sells paper products. Robert is studying advertising and now he can practice some of the activities. He needs to buy a machine, but since he doesn't have enough money, he is seeking a loan to buy a heat press and make advertising products in his business.

His dream is to have a great business, practice his profession in advertising and improve his income so in the future he can buy a house to live in with his wife.

loans.use: to buy a press and be able to offer advertising work in his business.

loans.name: Linda Melisa

texts.es:
Linda hace poco tiempo fue abandonada por el padre de sus hijos y desde entonces ha quedado como madre soltera cabeza de hogar, y debido a esto ha tenido que buscar diferentes fuentes de ingresos que le permitan solventar los gastos de su hogar. Hace 7 meses inició un negocio de comidas rápidas el cual saca al frente de su casa todas las noches, y gracias a este ha venido generando los ingresos que necesita para sostener a sus 2 hijos de 2 y 14 años de edad. La gran dificultad que se encuentra es la falta de capital en su negocio para poder satisfacer toda la demanda de sus clientes, pero ahora que tiene la oportunidad Linda busca un préstamo para comprar insumos para la preparación de las comidas rápidas y poder responder a los pedidos de sus clientes.

Su sueño es abrir una cafetería donde pueda tener mejores ingresos y también sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos brindándoles una buena educación.
texts.en:
Not long ago Linda was abandoned by the father of her children, and since then she's been a single mother head of household. Owing to this she's had to look for different sources of income that allow her to cover her household costs. Seven months ago she started a fast food business which she takes out in front of her house every night. Thanks to this she's been generating the income she needs to support her two children, aged 2 and 14. The greatest difficulty she finds is the lack of business capital to be able to satisfy all the demand from her customers. But now that she has the opportunity, Linda is looking for a loan to buy supplies for preparing fast food, in order to be able to fulfill her customers' orders.

Her dream is to open a cafe where she can have better income and also to get her two children ahead in life, by offering them a good education.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make fast food and be able to fill her customers' orders.

loans.name: Fabien

texts.en: Fabien is 32 years old. He owns a bar. He has been in the business for 8 years. He wants a loan to buy more beer for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy more beer for sale.

loans.name: Sovanara's Group

texts.en:
Sovanara resides in a rural area of the Kandal Province’s Kandal Stoeng district, Cambodia. He is 42 years old and married with five children, three of whom are dependent on him and still in school. To support his family, he has been involved in working as a paid taxi driver for 12 years whiles his wife plants sugarcane to help the family generate the income. The current business earns his family around 17,000 KHR per day and allows him to save about 6,000 KHR every day for future needs. Low crop yields resulting from flooding is the main challenge for his business.

Sovanara’s group consists of three members who are all males and it is his first microloan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. He is leading his group asking for a loan of 200,000 KHR each. He will use his portion to buy materials for construction of a sanitary latrine (such as a toilet), tile drainage, and sewage. He hopes this loan will enable his family to have a sanitary latrine to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy materials for construction of a sanitary latrine

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria comenzó hace unos 4 años a trabajar en la actividad de la crianza de ganado y producción de leche motivada principalmente por generar recursos para su familia que pudieran brindar una mejor calidad de vida, pues los ingresos que generaba su esposo estaban siendo insuficientes para el sostenimiento de sus gastos y los de sus 4 hijos. Como ya ha tenido conocimiento en la actividad, con unos ahorros compró su primera vaca y a partir de allí comenzó con la actividad, y ahora puede aportar recursos económicos que le permiten tener una mejor calidad de vida en su familia. Buscando seguir creciendo, Maria busca un préstamo para comprar ganado y aumentar su capacidad de producción.

Su sueño es continuar con esta actividad y generar recursos que le permitan mejorar la calidad de vida de su hogar y ofrecerles a sus 4 hijos una mejor educación.
texts.en:
Four years ago Maria started to work raising cattle and producing milk. She was motivated principally by the need to generate resources for her family that would be able to offer them a better quality of life, since the income her husband earned was not enough to support their household with four children. As she already had experience in this type of work, she used some savings to buy her first cow and from then on she started working. Now she can contribute financial resources that allow her family to have a better quality of life. Seeking to keep growing, Maria is looking for a loan to buy cattle and increase her production capacity.

Her dream is to continue with this type of work and generate resources that allow her to improve the quality of life for her home and offer a better education to her four children.

loans.use: to buy cattle and increase her production capacity.

loans.name: Andrea Cecilia

texts.es:
Andrea siempre ha sido reconocida por ser una persona muy trabajadora que con mucho esfuerzo ha venido sacando adelante su familia, pues a pesar de que no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar ha desempeñado diferentes labores en las que siempre deja muy buena imagen por su gran compromiso. Actualmente tiene un trabajo en un hogar pero los ingresos que allí recibe no están siendo suficientes para poder sostener los gastos de su familia, es por esto que ha decidido iniciar un negocio paralelo a este el cual es una venta de prendas de vestir. Gracias a que ha venido teniendo buenas ventas y siguen creciendo, Andrea busca un préstamo para comprar prendas de vestir y surtir su negocio para responder a los pedidos de sus clientes.

Andrea espera recibir cada vez mejores ingresos para ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Andrea has always been known as a a hardworking person who has gotten her family ahead with a lot of effort. Despite not having had a chance to go to school, she has worked at different things, always leaving a good impression because of her committment. Right now, she she has a job in a house but the money she makes there isn't enough to pay for her family expenses. That is why she has decided to start a side business selling clothing. Thanks to having good sales and growth, Andrea is seeking a loan to buy clothing and stock her business to respond to her customers' orders.

Andrea hopes to make more and more income to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing to stock her business to respond to her customers' orders

loans.name: Serapia

texts.es: La socia es la señora Serapia, ella continúa con su oficio  de corte y confección, elaborando diferentes tipos de manualidades en tela como cortinas, secadores de utensilios de cocina y artículos para el hogar en general y los comercializa en una de las principales ferias de la ciudad. Serapia trabaja duro para mejorar en su actividad, por ello esta ahorrando para comprar maquinaria que le permita ofrecer mejores productos a sus clientes, y en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar una máquina para remallado de telas. Serapia está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, por ayudarla a mejorar  su actividad económica la cual le permite ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “GRAN RENOVACION”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en: Serapia continues in her dressmaking occupation making various types of crafts like curtains, dish towels and articles for the home in general that she sells in one of the city’s main street markets.  Serapia works hard to improve her activity and is saving up to buy the machinery that will make it possible for her to offer her customers better products.  On this occasion she’s requesting a loan to buy a machine to darn fabric.  Serapia is very grateful for Kiva’s help to improve her economic activity that allows her to provide her family with better quality of life.  She’s a member of the “Gran Renovación” (Great Renewal) communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophie is married with ten children. Five of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (including her mother). She has a pub and has been in this business for six years. She generates additional income with rental houses. She operates her business in a shop and sells on a retail basis six days out of every week. 

Her major business challenges include rent for her business premises, off and on electricity, and transportation of crates of beer and soda. Sophie aspires to own a fully stocked pub and also to become a wholesaler. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity but not running water. Her monthly expenses include rent for her business premises and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda and boxes of mineral water

loans.name: Ayesh

texts.en:
Ayesh is a 29-year-old married woman who supports three family members. She is from Jarash, Jordan. Since Ayesh is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

Ayesh is requesting a 600 JOD loan to pay for home improvements. She would like to buy a new furniture. In the future, Ayesh wants to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements
